loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell .

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling fruits, vegetables and charcoal.

Mary Ann dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Banno

texts.en:
Banno is 38 years old, married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years with her husband (also shown in the photo).  They offer a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and have retained many customers. They make enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested for a loan of 50000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for their customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Banno  wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make their stock available for her customers

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana, es madre de 2 hijas, estudió hasta sexto grado, ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos y no pudieron apoyarla en sus estudios, situación por la cual empezó a trabajar desde muy joven y ayudar así con el sostén de la familia; ahora está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor y albañil.

Ana, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos desde hace 6 años, esta actividad se la enseño su compañero de vida, ya que era la única forma de trabajo que él conocía en ese momento, además de trabajar sus propios cultivos, Ana, vende productos por catalogo, para ayudar a su esposo con el sustento de su familia, para ir a sus cultivos tiene que caminar 2 kilómetros desde su vivienda.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono y pesticidas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con lo cual pretende tener una mejor cosecha.

Ana, desea tener un terrero propio donde pueda cultivar más y así lograr darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a mother of two girls and has studied through the sixth year of school, as her parents had limited resources and were not able to support her in her studies. Because of this situation, she began to work at a young age to help sustain her family. Now, she is married, and her husband is a farmer and bricklayer. 

Ana has made a living growing basic grains for the past six years. She learned this business from her husband, as it was the only form of work that he knew at the time – in addition to growing his own crops. Ana also sells products by catalogue in order to help her husband support their family. To get to her crops, she has to walk 2 kilometers from her home.  

Her loan will be used to buy fertilizer and pesticides to grow corn and beans, which should mean a better harvest. 

Ana wants to have her own land where she can grow more and therefore give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 24-year-old Lebanese woman living with her parents. In 2013 she opened a beauty salon in her town to help her brother, who is the main income provider in the family to meet the needs of life. She has her loyal customers, and she is well known in her region by her brilliant talents. 

Today, she’s requesting to make a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase equipment’s for her business such as scissors, hair brush, dryer... In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with a high quality of work.

loans.use: to purchase equipment’s for her business such as scissors, hair brush, dryer...

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen tiene 54 años y  está casada con el señor Librado, con quien tiene cuatro hijas todas mayores, que con sacrificio y esfuerzo ha podido criar.
Fue empleada por varios años en una empresa privada, con los años y con los anteriores préstamos de la fundación decidió abrir una despensa en su propia casa y así independizarse.
Carmen pide este préstamo para poder comprar galleta, arroz fideo, azúcar, leche, huevo, aceite etc., y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo y ventas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 54 years old and married to Librado, with whom she has four older girls – and has sacrificed much and worked hard with to raise them.  

She was employed for several years at a private business. With her experience and previous loans from the foundation, she decided to open a store in her home and therefore become independent.  

Carmen is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy cookies, rice, sugar, milk, eggs, oil, etc. – and thus be able to continue her work and sales.

loans.use: to buy cookies, rice, sugar, milk, eggs, oil, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has five children. 

He operates a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy place. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. His business goal is to have a large restaurant within five years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as self-driven. He operates a retail business where he repairs cameras and also installs CCTV cameras. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

Ronald describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the 45,000 KES loan to buy equipment for repairing cameras. His business goal is to be financially stable within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy equipment for repairing cameras

loans.name: Hottensia

texts.en:
Hottensia is a single woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be honest and she operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area fit for business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosalie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is 60 years old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 3 children.

 Currently, she requested a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income

loans.name: Mary Nanette

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Nanette works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell personal care products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mary Nanette is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more personal care products to sell like perfume, roll-on, etc. for her buy and sell personal care products business.

Mary Nanette has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell like perfume, roll-on, etc.

loans.name: Walayat Ali

texts.en:
Walayat Ali is 40, living with his spouse and two sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a milkman by trade; he sells milk, yogurt and butter in the market . His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk and dairy products from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market and the customers as well.

Due to quality and low reasonable rates many of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase the stock of milk on a daily basis and wants to buy milk and refrigerator for the preservation of dairy products. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a large refrigerator and also  milk in large quantity.

Therefore, Walayat Ali has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell and a refrigerator for preservation of milk and dairy products.

Walayat Ali is very happy after receiving this loan; he thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy more milk in bulk to sell and a large refrigerator for preservation of dairy products and milk.

loans.name: Altaf Hussain

texts.en:
Altaf Hussain is 30 years old and the father of five children. He owns a small firm in which he operates a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories; he employs laborers to work the molding machines on daily wages. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories, he needs different categories and qualities of raw materials. This time he has taken a huge contract but does not have enough cash in hand to buy raw materials to continue his manufacturing. Therefore, Altaf Hussain has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he is able to buy an additional molding machine and plastic raw materials for manufacturing accessories.

He has to look after a huge family; he has to take care of each child, their school fees, their diet and their health. For these purposes, he needs a huge income and he is the only person who is responsible for paying the household expenses. He is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional molding machine and plastic raw materials for manufacturing plastic accessories.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 57 years old and has twelve children.  She is married and five of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Marilou has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 47 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Jenny works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like condiments, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Jenny has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like condiments, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Conception is 54 years old and all of her children are in school.

Conception has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Conception requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of cococnut wine to sell.

Conception has been in this business for three years. In the future, Conception would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coocnut wine to sell.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 53 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school, Eulalia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like chips, bread, canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

Eulalia has been in this business for 11 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like chips, bread, canned goods, eggs, noodles, and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, a septic tank, and a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 36 years old. She is a married woman. She has a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a single woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be determined and she operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 47,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is 24 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Cherilyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cherilyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and earns additional income from direct selling personal collection products.

Cherilyn has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cherilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a 62-year-old married woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase raw materials like bamboo sticks, nipa leaves, string and other materials for her business.

Ester has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like bamboo sticks, nipa leaves, string and other materials for her business

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is 52 years old, married, and works hard to support her husband.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Daniela is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

Daniela has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and pensioner parents in Zugdidi district. His wife is a dentist and gets a monthly salary. 

Levan is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has 4 hectare agricultural land, where he grows maize.  Also he has 4 cows and produces cheese to sell. 

Levan decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for purchasing an apparatus to prepare land with fertilizer. This apparatus is fastened on the tractor and is useful for all the lenders and Levan will rent it out to generate income. He hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a special tractor-drawn apparatus to  rent out for preparing agricultural land

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 25 years old, married with one child.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marilyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mujeres De Barcelona Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres de Barcelona está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y las de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elida, quien se esta esforzando y luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante, comenta que tiene una despensa modesta que con mucho esfuerzo y lucha ha ido montando y surtiendo. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que quiere salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carnes, panificados, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y con ello poder seguir ayudando a su familia y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres de Barcelona [Women of Barcelona] is in its first loan cycle, a program of its women’s committee. It is a new group, where they work together and help each other get ahead in life. They are working to eliminate poverty, fighting for better living conditions for them and their families. 

One of the members is Mrs. Elida, who is working hard and striving to grow and succeed. She says that she has a modest store, that with much work and effort, has been growing and providing. She is a very entrepreneurial woman that wants to get ahead and through her work help her loved ones. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy various supplies to stock her store such as vegetables, fruits, meats, breads and others items – and thus be able to continue her work and continue helping her family and meeting her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meats, breads and other supplies to stock their store.

loans.name: Necias

texts.en:
Necias is 34 years old, married, and has two children to provide for. To earn a living and provide for his family, he runs a transport business and has been doing so for two years already. It is a good business for him because he is able to earn enough to cover their daily needs from it.

He wants to increase his income, so he decided to borrow a loan to buy motor parts for motor maintenance to continue catering to more passengers and create greater income.

Necias' plan for the future is to save money to sustain his children's education needs.

loans.use: to buy motor parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristita is 34 years old and has four children who are in school.

Cristita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cristita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Cristita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and has two children. Teresita is married and both of her children are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Teresita has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 55 years old and married.

Herminia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Herminia has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Herminia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en:
Sarwar is a 36-year-old, married woman. She has had a business purchasing and selling animals, with the help of her husband, for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. 

Sarwar is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 28 years old, married woman. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase along with her husband. Musarat is an energetic lady and working hard to support the needs of the family members. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 35000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires of improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Elvia Elisa

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Elvia, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 17 y 11 años los mismos que estudian en el colegio. El cónyuge es estibador de barcos.
Doña Elvia se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de  Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la tarde ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, da crédito y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y esto lo viene realizando desde hace siete años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Ella tiene 3 ciclos y lo que le gusta de la fundación es la facilidad para pagar y la unión del grupo. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, most popular and most visited seaside resort in Ecuador because of it's beautiful, inviting beaches. It is the largest deep water port of Ecuador and South America.

Elvia lives here. She is 42 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has two children aged 17 and 11 years old who study in secondary school. Her husband is a stevedore.

Elvia works selling Yanbal products by catalog (beauty items, perfume, cosmetics, and accessories for women). She works every day, mostly in the afternoon, as this is the easiest time for her to make her rounds. She sells from door to door, gives credit and collects each week. She loves to sell and she has been doing this for seven years. It is going very well for her as she has a large clientele. What she sells the most are cosmetics and perfume. She will use the loan to buy perfume, jewellery, cosmetics and creams.

She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles and what she likes about the Foundation is the ease of payment and the unity of her group. Her dream is for her children to complete their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfume, jewellery, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 36 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like can goods, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, chips, etc.

Melanie has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like can goods, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, chips, etc

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana, 25 years old, successfully runs a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market where he has maintained many contacts over the years. A mother of three children, Rehana is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Rehana wants to grow her business and so has requested a loan of 35000 PKR  to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices. These purchases will help meet increasing customer demand and boost her earnings so that she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices

loans.name: Rica Mae

texts.en:
Rica Mae is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a computer services business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy materials like ink, bond paper, etc. and to pay for electric and internet bills for her computer services business.

Rica Mae has been in this business for three years. She also earns more income from a general store.

Rica Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials like ink, bond paper, etc. and to pay for electric and internet bills

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La Sra. Lilian es Viuda hace aproximadamente 1 año, tiene un hijo menor que está cursando la escuela primaria, y por quien ella lucha para poder darle una vida digna.
Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados se inició trabajando con su marido en forma ambulante. Ella comenta que está muy contenta con la ayuda que está recibiendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar calzados varios para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Lilian is a widow as of approximately one year. She has a young son who is in primary school, and for whom she fights in order to provide a dignified life. She works selling shoes. She began working with her husband as a traveling merchant. She says that she is very happy with the help that she is receiving. She requests this loan to buy various shoes so that she is able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy various shoes to sell.

loans.name: Las Guerreras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Guerreras está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, lleva ese nombre el grupo ya que ellas son guerreras y están luchando por sus familias. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus respectivas familias.
La Sra. Claudia solicita de este préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de frutas, ya que quiere comprar frutas frescas para la venta, como naranjas, manzanas, peras, piñas, melones y otros. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con sacrificio ha podido salir adelante y mejorar.
Claudia está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y mejorar, todo por medio de las capacitaciones y la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
texts.en:
The group called Las Guerreras is in the first cycle of its Women's Committee Project. They chose this name because they are fighters, and they are fighting for their families. They are in this program to eliminate poverty in order to improve living conditions for themselves and their respective families.

Señora Claudia is requesting this loan to invest in her business of selling fruits. She intends to buy fresh fruit to sell, such as oranges, apples, pears, pineapples, melons, and others. She is a hard-working person who makes sacrifices in order to move forward and improve. Claudia is doing her very best to make progress and grow by means of training and the Poverty Elimination Survey.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell, such as oranges, apples, pears, pineapples, melons, and others.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a married man with four children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 10 years.

His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are loyal. He says that his biggest business challenge is transport. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal to sell. 

This is Cosmas' fourth  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan. He hopes that in the future he will have a big business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza, a married mother of five, describes herself as God-fearing. She has been operating a fish retail enterprise located in a highly populated area for five years now. Her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. 

Medza will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy a fish frying pan and more stocks of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy a fish frying pan and more stocks of fish

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 43-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Corazon has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 26 years old and married with one child in school. Charlene works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Charlene has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mujeres En La Lucha Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de 12 mujeres lleva por nombre Mujeres en la lucha está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir luchando por mejorar.
Mirta, una de las integrantes, se dedica a hacer y vender comidas varias, que ella misma se encarga de hacer y luego sale a vender. Es una mujer muy emprendedora que con sacrificio ha salido adelante y hoy día ya tiene una buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
This group of 12 women is named “Mujeres en la lucha” (Women in the Struggle).  The group is in its first cycle of the women’s communal bank program.  It is a new group where all of the women are putting forward their best effort to get ahead.  They are doing the elimination of poverty survey, where three of the women are below the poverty line, that is they are struggling to improve.  

Mirta, one of the members, works making and selling various foods that she herself is in charge of making and then going out to sell.  She is a very enterprising woman who, with sacrifice, has gotten ahead and today already has a good clientele.  

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase supplies to continue making her foods, such as meats, condiments, vegetables, baking products and other things.  In this way she can continue to satisfy her customers.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, baking products and other supplies for making food.

loans.name: Virgen Del Parana Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Virgen del Parana” esta dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Yanina, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir, que está en una pobreza extrema. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la peluquería que tiene va luchando y esforzándose por poder mejorar la economía de su familia y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos suficientes para poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, como ser: tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, peines y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called “Virgen del Parana” [Virgin of Parana] is part of a program to eliminate poverty, where they are all working to gauge the elimination of poverty in order to understand the lives of one another and through that be able to improve their living conditions. 

One of the members is Yanina who in her survey showed a level of poverty of level one – which signifies extreme poverty. Through hard work and her job as a hairdresser, she continues to fight and strives to improve the financial wellbeing of her family and loved ones. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy enough supplies to provide her customers with a good service such as hair dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, combs and other items – and thus be able to continue working as she does. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received to be able to improve and continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, combs and other supplies.

loans.name: Naili

texts.en:
Naili is 51 years old. She is widowed and lives with her daughter and granddaughter in Gori district, Georgia. 

The family has no source of income. Naili and her daughter are unemployed. Naili was working in Turkey and now she wants to start a business to generate income. 

The Start-Up Program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan to start a clothes trading business. Naili will go to Turkey and purchase clothes at wholesale prices and resell them in Gori at higher prices. She will be able to generate income and feed her family.

loans.use: to begin a clothes trading business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 47-year-old married woman with five children. She has one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lucia has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more fruit to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Oñondivepa está en su ciclo número (21º) del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, es un grupo luchador y unido, donde todas ponen su mejor esfuerzo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Griselda quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la peluquería que tiene va adquiriendo los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Griselda es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora que quiere salir adelante, y es por eso que pone su mejor entusiasmo para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes de pelos, shampoo, cremas, y otros insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando en su emprendimiento.
texts.en: The group called Oñondivepa is in its 21st cycle of the women’s committee program, where all of the women work and help one another get ahead. It is a determined and united group, where everyone puts forth their best efforts. One of the members is Griselda. Through her effort and continuous work and by means of her hair salon, she has secured the means to help her loved ones. Griselda is a very selfless and determined person who wants to get ahead. This is why she puts forth her best enthusiasm to help her loved ones. She requests this loan to buy hair dyes, shampoo, creams, and other products in order to continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, shampoo, creams, and other products.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 40-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. She has been working since 2000 at her house in tailoring to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. 

To better develop her work, Nada is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to purchase textiles for the summer season with the aim of increasing her income and improving her work. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and serve properly her customers.

loans.use: to purchase textiles for the summer season

loans.name: Lara5 Group

texts.en:
Youmna is the featured borrower for Lara5 Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Youmna is a 44-year-old, single lady who lately started working as a hairdresser from her house to cover her needs and expenses. She is an independent lady who is trying desperately to improve her living conditions; thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary beauty tools and cosmetics to satisfy her customers' requests and provide them with better service. 

Youmna is the lady sitting in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Lara is the first lady on the left, and Hibat Allah is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary beauty tools and cosmetics

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas 2  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que se puso como meta crecer y mejorar y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Cada una quiere crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
Una persona que se destaca por ser una persona entusiasta y luchadora, que siempre participa de manera activa, es la Sra. Lilian, quien se dedica a vender prendas variadas. Ella tiene muchos deseos de superarse y poder crecer cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser jeans, camisas, pantalones, blusas, vestidos y otros, de manera a poder seguir mejorando y luchando cada día.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas 2 (United Women 2) is in its first cycle of the women’s communal bank program.  It is a new group that put forward as its goal growing and improving and helping one another.  Each one wants to grow, not only economically but also as a person.  

One of the people that stands out for being an enthusiastic and determined person, who always actively participates, is Lilian, who makes a living selling various articles of clothing.  She has many desires to better herself and to be able to grow with each day.  

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various garments to sell, such as jeans, shirts, pants, blouses, dresses and other things.  In this way she will be able to continue improving and striving every day.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, pants, blouses, dresses and other garments.

loans.name: Union Femenina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unión Femenina está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar. 
La Sra. Evangelista, una de las integrantes, solicita de este préstamo para invertir en su negocio de despensa ya que quiere comprar verduras, frutas, carne, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ella comenta que poco a poco se ha abierto camino.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
This group, Union Femenina, is in its first cycle of the women committee program. It is a new group that is putting forth its best effort in order to improve its life conditions. These women are in the poverty elimination program, fighting to improve.

Evangelista, one of the members, is requesting a loan to invest in her grocery store business. She wants to buy vegetables, fruits, meats, baked goods, and other items so that she can continue with her sales. She states that she has made her way little by little. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meats, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 30-year-old married mother of one child who has been working since 2010 at her house selling homemade foods in order to help her family to meet the needs of life and live in a good way and to help her husband who owns a spare parts. 

Today, she is obtaining a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to improve her business merchandise to give the best product to its clients. She is very happy and optimistic that she will sell all products and expanding her business area. She hopes that in the future, she might open her own store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to improve her home made pickles business merchandise

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en:
Zaib is 58 years old, a married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Zaib  has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR. She wants to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells auto spare parts. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spare parts. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of auto spare parts

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El Comité  La Amistad esta en el 2do ciclo, todas ellas son de la ciudad de Luque, y tienen el sueño de ir mejorando cada una en el emprendimiento que hace, y con su trabajo dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una persona digna de admirar es la Sra. Albina, quien se dedica a las costuras, hace todo tipo de confecciones, y comenta que se ha formado ya de muy buena clientela que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos, y es por medio de su trabajo que tiene los medios para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones, gomas y otros productos para poder usar y con ello cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
El Comité La Amistad [Friendship Committee] is in its second cycle. All of the women are from the city of Luque, and all of them dream of continuing to improve what they each undertake and through their work, give their loved ones everything they were unable to have. 

Ms. Albina is a dignified person to admire. She works as a seamstress and does all kinds of sewing. She says she has developed a very good clientele that always put in many orders with her. Through this work she has the means to help her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, buttons, elastic, and other products to use and fulfill her customers’ orders. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting to be able to grow.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, elastic, and other products.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jeni is in her mid-40s, Single and has two children in school. She had a genge selling fruits and vegetables for 4 years now. Her business is doing well and she is able to care for her family. She works from 6 am to 9 pm per working day and is able to make a good return per month. 

This is her 7th  loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will invest this loan to improve her business with new stock of fruits and vegetables that are demanded. She will buy fruits and vegetables to resell in her genge. 

In the coming days, she would like her business to be of good appearance (managing big stock). Jenii will share this loan with her loan group "Mpunga", which totals four members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell in her genge.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is a married man and has 9 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a tailoring business where he makes school uniforms, suits etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are schools and locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to be able to create more employment opportunities within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. 

This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials for making school uniforms

loans.name: Rosenia

texts.en:
Rosenia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She has a general store in the Philippines and industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like rice retailing.

Rosenia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries. She dreams of one day being able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Syrga

texts.ru: Сырга, 56 лет, в разводе, мать 5 дочерей. У Сыргы- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей одеждой, стартовав 10 лет назад с 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сыргы, в обороте есть товар на сумму 221,690 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Сырга обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Syrga is 56 years old, divorced, and the mother of five daughters. Syrga has a high school education. 

As a main source of income for her family, she works with selling clothing, after having started ten years ago with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Syrga's persistent work, she currently has clothing worth 221,690 som (KGS) in her store. The monthly income is around 19,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Syrga turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase clothing for selling. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for selling in her shop

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en: Sameena is a 30-year-old married woman who has been doing a business purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 59 years old and married with eight children. Natividad works very hard to provide for them.

Natividad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Natividad has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Natividad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Raazia

texts.en:
Raazia  is 46 years old, married woman and a mother of 6 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem , 49 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Naseem needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

She has requested a loan of PKR 40000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc

loans.name: Cristalina Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (JUANA ELMAIRA, KENYA y MYUREL) del municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 12 meses, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

MYUREL: Es integrante del grupo solidario CRISTALINA, madre soltera de un pequeño de 2 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijo, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos que compra en la comunidad miskita cercana a Bilwi que se llama Lamlaya (agua mansa). Está solicitando préstamo para poder comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
This group consists of three women entrepreneurs – Juana Elmaira, Kenya and Myurel – from the city of Puerto Cabezas. They formed the group 12 months ago to access financing through credit in order to improve their incomes and be able to cover the basic needs of their homes, ensure education for their children and improve their households. 

Myurel is a member of the group "Cristalina" and is a single mother of a young two-year-old. In order to raise her son, three years ago she started making a living selling seafood and fish that she buys near Bilwi in the Miskito community called Lamlaya, meaning “still water.”

She is asking for a loan to buy more seafood and fish products in order sell them, increase her income and serve more people that are requesting this product – one of the staple foods in Bilwi. She dreams of one day having enough capital to establish a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more seafood and fish products.

loans.name: Salamti

texts.en:
Salamti is a 50 years old, married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. Both are running a general store in their community. Over the time they have become popular in their town for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 8 children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon is 38 years old, a homemaker with three children in her care. She resides in a village in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. All of her children attend school. Her husband is 34 and has been a black smith since 2010, earning approximately $10 daily. 

Her husband always goes to work far from home, so she decided to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to commute to work. This loan will help her husband reduce his traveling expenses. In the future, Phon wants to run a small grocery store at home, renovate her house and support her children to earn high education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Rebal

texts.en:
Rebal is a 20-year-old single young man. He started four years ago working with his father to cover his needs and expenses, and to build his own personality. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who is still continuing his studies beside his job. 

Today, Rebal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his accounting studies. He is a clever man who has a lot of dreams for the future, and who believes that achieving the dreams needs a lot of studying and hard work.

loans.use: to pay for his university studies in accounting

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 55 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

Lucy has been in this business for five years. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines and also earns income from raising pigs.

Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, margarine, butter, sugar, etc. for her bakery business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.

Jenelyn hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, margarine, butter, sugar, etc. for her business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and an Internet cafe.  

Wilma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, soft drinks, eggs, etc., to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, soft drinks, eggs, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Zhamal

texts.ru: Жамал, 56 лет, замужем, воспитала 5 детей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, она 13 лет занимается полеводством и разведением скота. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день, Жамал имеет в хозяйстве 6 коров, 10 овец и 1,0 Га земли, где выращивает картофель, пшеницу и клевер. Деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 14,500 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жамал обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и накопить на постройку дома.
texts.en:
Zhamal is 56 years old, married and has raised five children. As a source of income for her family, she has worked with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding for 13 years. 

Thanks to persistent work, Zhamal currently has six cows and ten sheep on her farm, as well as 1.0 hectares of land where she grows potatoes, wheat and clover. The business brings a monthly income of 14,500 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Zhamal turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves to increase her herd. She plans to invest the income from her loan in further developing her business and save money for building a house.

loans.use: to purchase calves in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam  is 35 years old vigorous, married woman, with 2 children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years.  She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. 

Shabnam’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an other motorcycle for generating income.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila, age 32, is a married woman. She has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. 

She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment, which will allow her to cater to more customers consistently

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen's son (also shown in the photo) has been running a fruit sales business for many years. He is very enthusiastic in his work and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to contribute to the family income.

To improve her son's business Nasreen contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently, which ultimately will enable them to cover their utility bills in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 48 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Уже 5 лет она занимается торговлей формы для военных и служащих. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Элмира достигла больших успехов и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 16,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в обороте есть товар на сумму 150,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку формы для реализации. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Elmira is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She has worked with selling uniforms to the military and civil servants for five years. Thanks to her hard and capacious work, Elmira has had great success. She managed to get a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS). She currently has stock worth 150,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Elmira turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase uniforms for selling. Elmira plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase military clothing for selling in her shop

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Равшан, 32 года, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает в школе преподавателем географии и биологии. С 2004 года в качестве дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 5 коров. На 2,0 Га арендованной и 0,30 Га собственно земли она выращивает кукурузу и хлопок. На сегодняшний день деятельность Равшан приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 19,000 сом (KGS). Равшан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку строительных материалов для постройки загона для скота. Доходы от бизнеса Равшан планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Ravshan is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She has higher education and works as a school teacher in geography and biology. 

As a source of income, Rvshan has also worked with agriculture since 2004. She has five cows on her farm. She grows sweet corn and cotton on 2.0 hectares of rented land and 0.30 hectares of her own land. Currently this business brings Ravshan a monthly income of 19,000 som (KGS). 

Ravshan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS). She will direct this money towards purchasing building materials for building a paddock for her cattle. Ravshan plans to use the income from the business to develop her farm.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a paddock for her livestock

loans.name: Santo Rey Group

texts.es:
17 son las integrantes de este grupo llamado Santo Rey está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cinthia quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropa que hace logra tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere crecer y salir adelante por sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, jeans, blusas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group called Santo Rey is made up of 17 members and is in its 6th cycle of the women's communal bank program, where they are all doing the poverty elimination survey.  One of the members is Cinthia who, through her efforts, continuous work and by means of selling clothing, has managed to have the means to help her family.  She is a very hardworking person who wants to grow and get ahead for her loved ones.  

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various garments to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, blouses and other items.  In this way she will be able to continue with her sales.  She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, jeans, blouses and other types of garments.

loans.name: Buenos Aire Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras (ALICIA, LUMERIANA y MAGGY) que se integraron hace 1 año, para gestionar  financiamiento mediante créditos con garantía solidaria, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios, de esa manera poder vender más y mejorar sus ingresos. Todas ellas quieren lograr mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

ALICIA: Es la Coordinadora del grupo Solidario BUENOS AIRES, es una señora alegre y sonriente con cualidades de líder, casada con 3 hijos que estudian su secundaria. Desde hace 7 años estableció un pequeño comedor de comida casera en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de Bilwi, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Esta solicitando su cuarto financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para elaborar fritos, tacos, vigoron, enchiladas, carne asada y refrescos naturales. Gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido diversificar sus productos al vender bastimentos. Ella sueña con mejorar la infraestructura del local de su comedor.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 tenacious women (ALICIA, LUMERIANA and MAGGY) that came together as a group a year ago in order to financially handle loans with solidarity guarantee, in order to buy  goods for their small businesses, and so be able to sell more and increase their incomes. All of the women want to be able to improve their conditions in life, to be able to cover their basic needs, assure their children’s educations and improve their homes. 

ALICIA: She is the coordinator of the solidarity group BUENOS AIRES. She is a happy and smiling woman with the qualities of a leader. She is married with 3 children who are in secondary school. Seven years ago she started a small dining room with home-cooked food in a section she has in one of the markets in Bilwi. She is requesting her fourth financing to buy supplies and ingredients to produce fried food, tacos, vigorón [a traditional Nicaraguan dish], enchiladas, carne asada, and natural beverages. Thanks to the loans previously granted by PANA PANA and financed by KIVA, she has been able to diversify her products selling food. She dreams of improving the infrastructure of the dining room space.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to produce fried food, tacos, vigorón [a traditional Nicaraguan dish], enchiladas, carne asada, and natural beverages

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria es separada y tiene una hija pequeña, ella posee inmuebles y salones comerciales los cuales los alquila, obteniendo así un ingreso importante para poder ayudar a su hija.
Ella está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Sueña con poder seguir creciendo cada día.
Este préstamo lo pide para poder ser usado en mantenimiento y reparación del sistema eléctrico de sus locales los cuales alquila.
texts.en:
Maria is separated and has a small daughter. She owns furniture and commercial salons which she rents out, and in this way earns an important income to support her daughter. 

She is striving to improve living conditions for herself and her loved ones. She dreams of continuing to progress with each passing day. 

She is requesting this loan for maintenance work and repairs on the electrical system of her properties which she rents out.

loans.use: perform maintenance work and repairs on her property's electrical system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tempura (seafood or vegetables that have been battered and deep fried).

loans.name: Kimloeurn's Group

texts.en:
Kimloeurn is aged 48 years old and a mother of three children, living in Banteay Meanchey province. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and growing vegetable for sale. She has been involved in these businesses for twenty-three years and it earns her about 43,000KHR per day.

Due to her crop not growing well last year, her income is decreased which causes her to lead a group to apply for a loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. 

This is the first loan cycle for her group, which consist of two members. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and a hand tractor to support her current business. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more money and create a new business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a hand tractor to support her current business

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 59 years old, married, and has five children.

Lorna is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of fertilizer, seeds, and other farm supplies.

Lorna has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer, seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dodaviel

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Dodaviel works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Dodaviel is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Dodaviel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is 58 years old, married woman, with 3 children. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits. 

This monetary help can take Farhat closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet embroidery orders of her customers, to earn a good profit

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a married man with 2 children. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain season which affects business. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to have a  bigger shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a bigger business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes for sale at his stall

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar,rice, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are the general public. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items. His business goal is to open a supermarket within 5 years. 

This is his third  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Bunloeur

texts.en:
Bunloeur, 24 years old, is a married woman with a small child. She lives in a village in the Siem Reap province in Cambodia. She works in a phone shop and makes a daily income of $3. Her husband is 25 years old and works in construction as a painter, earning around $8 each day.

Bunloeur’s present house is old, so she and her family members have been in difficulty to live in it, especially in the rainy season, which is coming soon. That’s why she has decided to take out a loan to buy lumber to build a house and also buy a motorcycle for commuting to work. This loan will help her have enough finances to build a proper house for her family to live in and improve the family’s traveling conditions.

For more future plans, Bunloeur hopes to run a business of selling vegetables at the market and help her child in earning a high school diploma.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house and also buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 42 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eleonor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Eleonor has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Eleonor would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and married with six children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
