Manana is a 50-years-old married woman. She lives with her husband Akaki in Telavi, East Georgia. Akaki works as a driver and gets monthly income. Manana is very hardworking woman. She works physically and gets small daily income. Manana wants to start a family business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for purchasing a car. Akaki will drive the car and they will trade fruits and vegetables in different villages. Manana hopes that the business will be profitable and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and to start a trading business

loans.name: Naian's Group

texts.en:
Nai An is 51-year-old, living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district and a mother of two children. Nowadays, she grows tobaccos and raises cow to earn more income. She has been involved in these businesses for thirty-three years, she could make around 50,000KHR per day and she is able to save around 25,000KHR each day from her business.

Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for new loan and this is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan helps her to have a better house to stay. She is the group leader of two members, will use her loan portion to pay for hand tractor rental fees. She hopes that this loan will enable her to get more income so as to send children to school.

loans.use: to pay for hand tractor rental fees to make an income for school fees

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Özdem

texts.en:
Özdem is 39 years old. After working for many years in the private sector and losing her job, she started selling lingerie and pyjamas with very little capital. With the help of her third loan from Maya, she bought lingerie and pyjamas in bulk and increased her capital. After the increase in the variety of her products and the number of customers, she had to spare a room in her house for her growing business. In the future she wants to open a store of her own.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Özdem hanım 39 yaşında ve uzun yıllar özel sektörde çalıştıktan sonra işsiz kalmış.  İşsiz kalınca küçük bir sermaye ile iç çamaşır ve pijama alarak mahallesindeki kadınlara satmaya başlamış.  Mayadan 3. kredisini kullanan Özdem hanım bu kredileri toptan iç çamaşırı ve pijama alarak sermayesini artırdı.  Ürün çeşidinin ve müşteri sayısının artması üzerine evindeki odalardan birini sadece bu iş için ayırdı.  Özdem Hanım gelecekte bu iş üzerine bir iş yeri açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and pyjamas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sorghum to make a drink and also for sale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a single man. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for use transporting people

loans.name: Virgen Del Lujan Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Virgen De Lujan” está en su 6º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3  de las 22 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sandra, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en una pobreza extrema. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que está luchando y se esfuerza por mejorar, ella se dedica a la venta de panificados ya que tiene una modesta panadería que formo con mucho esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar harina en cantidad, levadura, huevos, mantecas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su esfuerzo, luchando y esforzándose cada día. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir sacrificándose.
texts.en:
The group "Virgen de Lujan" is in its 6th cycle of its women's committee, where everyone commits to working and helping each other to excel. They are conducting a survey to eliminate poverty, where 3 of the 22 women find themselves below the poverty line, which is called extreme poverty. 

One of the members is Sra. Sandra, whose survey showed a level of poverty around level one, which is considered extreme poverty. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person who strives and fights to improve. She makes her living selling various breads. She already has a modest bakery which she started with much determination.

She requested this loan in order to buy wholesale flour, yeast, eggs, butter, and other ingredients, in order to continue enthusiastically, determinedly, and striving every day. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale, yeast, eggs, butter, and other supplies.

loans.name: Marom's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Marom is 35-year-old. She is a mother of four children and they are in school. For her living, she grows tobacco and sells ice-cream for seventeen years. Her daily family income earns about 52,000KHR per day, but she is able to save around 25,000KHR each day after offsetting her family expenses. 

She is applying for first loan with VisionFund to lead a group of two members. She will use her entire loan to buy corn seed and pay for hand tractor fees for her farmland. She highly hopes that this loan will help her to gain more yields so as to improve her family’s living condition and keep children in school until their graduation.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and pay for hand tractor rental fees for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 59 years old and married with eight children, one of whom in school, Angela works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a making nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nipa leaves, etc.

Angela has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nipa leaves, etc

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene works hard to support her family. Irene is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Irene has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Irene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 53 years old, widow woman and a mother of 5 children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses

loans.name: Claudia Yaneth

texts.es: Claudia tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo de 36 años y sus dos hijos de 16 y 13 años de edad. Claudia posee un puesto de venta de tortillas las cuales a diario elabora  en su casa de habitación, lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y junto a su esposo mantener  la economía del hogar y brindar a sus hijos todo lo necesario. Claudia anteriormente obtuvo un crédito para reparar el techo de la vivienda y comprar puertas y ventanas para la misma, debido a la buena experiencia y con el fin de ver su casa cada vez más bonita solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en cemento, arena y ladrillo para piso para mejorar su vivienda en la parte interna y el corredor.
texts.en:
Claudia, 31, lives in her own home with her husband, 36, and her two children, 16 and 13.

Claudia has a sales stall for tortillas, which she makes at home every day.  This allows her to earn a daily living and, with her husband, support the home finances and give her children everything they need.

Claudia received a loan to repair the roof of her house and to buy doors and windows.  She's asking FUSAI for another loan because of her good experience and her goal to make her house nicer all the time.  She's going to buy cement, sand, and floor bricks to improve the inside and the porch of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and floor bricks to improve the inside and the porch of her home

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is from Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Aged 46 and is happily married to Fausta. Their children are already married and have families of their own. Wildredo does his best to  earn to provide for his and his spouse everyday needs.

Wilfredo has a small variety store for five years already. He does not allow poverty in the Philippines to hinder them from improving their lives. He has successfully manage his store and has survived despite the stiff competition. He earns a minimum net income of Php 700 a day which is just enough to cover their basic needs.

To sustain his business he humbly requests your assistance for a Php 13000 loan which he will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages etc. He wants to see to it that he has most of the essential food items to attract more customers and to compete with the other stores nearby. 

He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him since it will greatly help maintain and grow his store thus help fund him and his wife's daily personal and household needs.

Wilfredo's simple dream is to expand his store and someday open a big grocery store. He prays to live long and enjoy a good life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Aljon

texts.en:
Aljon is a 20 years old and single. He wants to help his parents for living that's why he engaged in a transport business. He aims to increase his income so that he can provide what his parents needs. So he decided to borrowed a loan to buy motor parts for motor maintenance to continue cater more passengers and able to generate greater income.

Aljon plan for the future to save money out from his business for his education needs.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is 34 years old and married with two children, two children are still in school, Yuri works very hard to provide for them.

Yuri runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Yuri has been in this business for 7 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 57 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 5 and 15 year. They all go to school. 

He sells clothes and he is in a business for the past 4 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes for sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land. In future, he aims to earn at least 200,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Jevany

texts.en:
Jevany is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Jevany is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jevany requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for repair of her pig pens.

Jevany has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jevany would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the repair of her pig pens.

loans.name: Abram

texts.en: Abram is 25, recently married, and a carpenter. He previously requested a 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates. After marriage, Abram's monthly expenses increased and he decided to expand his project by a 10,000 EGP loan to generate more income for his family. The loan will help Abram buy more wood and modern tools for his carpentry.

loans.use: To buy more wood and modern tools for his carpentry.

loans.name: Zanib

texts.en:
Zanib is 55 years old, married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Zanib makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested for a loan of 45000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Zanib  wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at low rates to make stock available for her customers

loans.name: Mevlüde

texts.en:
Mevlüde is married and a mother of two.  She is selling lingerie and beauty products from catalogs from home and she is contributing to the family budget with her children's school expenses.  With the help of her fourth loan from Maya she bought bulks of her products.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Mevlüde hanım evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.  Mevlüde hanım evinden çamaşır ve katalog üzerinden güzellik ürünleri (farmasi) satarak çocuklarının eğitim masraflarına katkı sağlıyor.  Maya dan dördüncü kredisini kullanan Mevlüde hanım kredileri ile toptan ürün aldı.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and beauty products

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. Analyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets.

Analyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Analyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets

loans.name: Welbeth

texts.en:
Welbeth is 45 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Welbeth works very hard to provide for them.

Welbeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, eggs, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Welbeth has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, detergent soap, etc. 

Welbeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, eggs, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood is 49 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Zeliha

texts.en:
Zeliha is married and has a child.  She started looking for a job in order to support her husband with the expenses.  Her child was small so she had to stay at home and she started selling lingerie and socks from home.  

First she made sales to her relatives and neighbours but later on she increased the number of her customers.  With the help of her first loan from Maya she bought socks wholesale and increased her profit.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Zeliha hanım evli ve bir çocuk annesi.  Eşine ve ev giderlerine destek olmak için bir iş aramaya başlamış.  Çocuğunun küçük olması sebebiyle evden çamaşır ve çorap satışına başlamış.  Önce akrabalarına ve komşularına satış yapmış daha sonra zamanla müşteri potansiyelini artırmış.  Mayadan ilk kredisini kullanan Zeliha Hanım bu kredi ile toptan çorap alarak kar oranını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy socks wholesale for resale

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en:
Akbari is 36 years old, single woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her brother who is also shown in the photo. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is happily supporting her family through her business. 

She has requested a loan of 50000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 11 years. Rosalinda earns more income from internet cafe.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Welma is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Welma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Welma requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell to customers.

Welma has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Welma would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 54 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Cleofe is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Cleofe has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is 40 years old, married woman and a mother of 4 children.   She with her husband (also shown in the photo) is doing work in agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides.  Currently she has applied a loan of 40000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 49 years old and has three children. Emelita is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Emelita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Emelita requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emelita has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Emelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Slilma Lila Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario SLIMA LILA, es en vocablo miskito que significa estrella lila, está conformado por 3 mujeres (ISOLDA, NELLY y SENAYDA), todas son indígenas  miskitas de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que  aportan para las necesidades básicas de sus hogares. Se organizaron recientemente para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

SENAYDA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora de 54 años de edad, con cualidades de líder, casada. Desde hace 8 años vende ropa usada, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar una paca de shorts usados en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a tener el suficiente capital para ser una comerciante mayorista de paca sellada en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SLIMA LILA is a Miskito term meaning "lilac star," and it consists of three women (Isolda, Nelly, and  Senayda). They are all indigenous Miskita, from the city of Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are hardworking women who contribute to the basic needs of their households. They recently organized to get loans with supportive guarantees in Pana Pana

Senayda is the group coordinator. She is a 54 year old woman, married, with qualities of a leader. For 8 years she has sold used clothing, thus contributing to her household needs. She is asking for her first loan to buy a pack of used shorts in Managua in order to sell them at accessible prices to her clients in Bilwi. She dreams about having sufficient funds to be a wholesale vendor of sealed packs of clothing in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.

SENAYDA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora de 54 años de edad, con cualidades de líder, casada. Desde hace 8 años vende ropa usada, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar una paca de shorts usados en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a tener el suficiente capital para ser una comerciante mayorista de paca sellada en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas.

loans.use: to buy a pack of used shorts in Managua.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silk screening paint and blowers

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 35 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 54 years old, married with fifteen children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like can goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Nora has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from buy and sell chicharon.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like can goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Boules

texts.en:
Boules is 30, married and has 3 children. He has a small grocery store project. He previously requested 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it in due dates. 

Boules is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator and some ice-cream and fizzy drinks to increase his sales and generate more income.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and some ice-cream and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar and biscuits for selling

loans.name: Fakhira

texts.en:
Fakhira is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Fakhira is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 45000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and cloth to sew more dresses on time.  She hopes to get increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time

loans.name: Jeddidah

texts.en:
Jeddidah is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap,milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are loyal. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt, flour and other items. 

Her business goal is to open other business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt, flour and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts for repairing and servicing his maize mill so as to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Reanalen

texts.en:
Reanalen is 22 years old with two children.

Reanalen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Reanalen has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

Reanalen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 52 years old and married with five children. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Nida has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Nida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and the mother of three.  When her husband's income was not enough she started selling lingerie to women's groups.  She once opened a store but the expenses were high so she had to close it and continued selling from home.  

With the help of her fourth loan from Maya she will buy bulk supplies of lingerie.  She wants her children to have a good future.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Fatma Hanım evli ve 3 çocuk annesi.  Eşinin geliri ev ve çocukların masraflarına yetmemeye başlayınca Fatma Hanım günlerde iç çamaşır satışı yapmaya başlamış.  Bir dönem iç çamaşır dükkânı açmış fakat dükkân giderleri fazla gelince dükkânını kapatmış ve satışa devam etmiş.  Fatma hanım Maya dan dördüncü kredisini de çamaşır alımı için kullanıyor ve çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek bırakmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy underwear for sale

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 36 years old, married woman and a mother of 6 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 47 years old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Halima’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Halima  has requested for 40000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo for milk, to cater to more customers and provide better standards of living to family members

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 40 year old, married woman. She has been doing a business of selling fruits for many years. Her husband and son also assist her in dealing with customers.  She is a loving mother of 7 children. She is responsible for their food, health and clothing and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement for her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 35000 PKR  to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently which ultimately enable her to cover her utility bills on time

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently which enables her to pay her utility bills

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 31 year old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the engine of his van as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. 

That is why Asia has requested a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR for her husband, who will buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. Asia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 21, single, suffers from a physical disability and is unemployed, as a result. He has 5 brothers and his father is on pension. 

Mahmoud started a small grocery store project in his house and is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator for his project and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for his home based store, due to a physical disability

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a Kiva borrower with 2 children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open other business branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable family.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 24, single and has a small cattle fattening project. His parents are aging and unemployed. Abdullah is financially responsible for them. 

He is requesting 10,000 EGP to buy 2 heads of cattle to make more cheese and butter and allow his mother and sister to sell them in the local market and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy 2 heads of cattle for fattening and also milk and cheese sales

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Bavakan

texts.en:
Bavakan is 52 years old and with her husband and her son’s family she lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Bavakan has vocational education and she graduated training college. Several years she managed to work of her specialty, as a saleswoman at different markets, until she became engaged in farming and agriculture which now her only occupation. 

On her farm she has a cow, a calf, bulls and chickens. Bavakan in her village is very famous of her made tasty and good cheese which she sells with her farm’s other dairy-products such as milk, some meat and eggs. She also has a vegetable garden from which she has harvest of very tasty tomato, cucumber, beans and also potato. 

The sale of all these makes her family living, but she would like very much to provide better living conditions for her to pretty grandchildren. She greatly wants enlarge the number of her cattle; so with this Kiva loan she hopes to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Elma

texts.es:
Elma tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y su menor hija en una zona rural del distrito de Zaña que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Elma se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno así como a la venta de leche que este produce, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con mas de 1 año de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus vacas. Con esto Elma espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elma is 27 years old. She lives with her spouse and her young daughter in a rural part of the district of Zaña which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Elma works rising and selling cattle and also the milk that they produce. Her business is located at her house. She has more than one year experience in the business and has very good personal and work references from the area. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy balanced feed for her cattle. Doing this Elma hopes to offer a better product to her clients which will allow her to generate greater income and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.en:
Hipolita, 62 years old, is married and has two children, one of them in school. Hipolita works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 11 years, Hipolita has run a general store in the Philippines. 

Hipolita has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan through NWTF to further build her business. She will use her PHP 10,000 loan to buy eggs, junk food, canned goods, home care products and other groceries. In the future, Hipolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, junk food, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Felomino

texts.en: Felomino, 59 years old, is married and has eight children, one of them still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 5 years, Felomino has operated an egg vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more trays of eggs to sell to her customers. Felomino would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en:
Arcadia, 61 years old, is married and has eleven children, two of them in school. Arcadia works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 6 years, Arcadia has run a general store in the Philippines.

Arcadia has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan through NWTF to further build her business. She will use her PHP 15,000 loan to buy additional items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, home care products and other groceries to sell. In the future, Arcadia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, home care products and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Pablo Josué

texts.es: Pablo Josué, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposa  y su hijo, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de equipo y materiales requeridos para  trabajos en la soda y así poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de platillos y bebidas, y de esta manera poderle ofreces a los clientes una mayor cantidad y variedad de platillos y de productos para el consumo humano y todos de la mejor calidad. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su negocio y cumplir algunas metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para el y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Pablo Josué is 30 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and lives with his wife and their son who are his top priority.  With this loan he intends to purchase equipment and supplies for his food stall so that he can offer a wider variety of meals and drinks.  This way he will be able to provide his customers with a larger amount and variety of high quality foods.  He expects that this investment will allow him to increase his earnings so that he can continue to invest in his business and complete certain goals that will improve his and his family's quality of live in the future.  

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. Prior to this, he had never had a loan through a national bank but FUDECOSUR has given him this loan with great ease and a low interest rate.

loans.use: purchase equipment for a food stand

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
Jose Alberto tiene 33 años de edad, conviviente, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Jose Alberto se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cerdos,lechones, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto José alberto espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Alberto is 33 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives in the rural part of Cayaltí which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Jose Alberto works buying and selling small animals like pigs, ducks and turkeys amongst others. His business is located at his house. He has a number of years experience in the field and has very good personal and work references in the area. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals like pigs and piglets amongst others as well as balanced feed for them. Doing this Jose Alberto hopes to offer a better product to his clients which will allow him to generate greater income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals like pigs and piglets amongst others as well as balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Luis Mariano

texts.es: Luis de 54 años de edad y habita en casa humilde pero de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida de 51 años  y su hijo de 25 años de edad. Luis labora en una empresa de seguridad desde hace varios años,  tiempo durante el cual le ha permitido llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y mantener la economía de su familia. Luis anteriormente solicito un crédito para invertir en la reparación del techo de su vivienda dado que con el que contaba se encontraba deteriorado y en tiempos de lluvia le presentaba filtraciones d agua, gracias a la buena experiencia ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para poder comprar lamina, madera y  clavos con el propósito de hacer una pequeña galera y  ampliar el corredor de su vivienda y brindar mayor protección a su familia.
texts.en: Luis, 54, lives in a humble home that he owns with his 51 year old wife and their 25 year old son.  Luis has worked for a security company for many years, during which he has been able to provide for his family and support his household. Previously, Luis sought a loan to repair his roof since it was in poor shape and leaked whenever it rained.  Because of the good experience that he had, he decided to seek a new loan through FUSAI in order to purchase sheet metal, wood and nails so that he can build a small hen house and expand the veranda in his home, all with the goal of providing more protection to for his family.

loans.use: purchase sheet metal, wood and nails in order to build a small hen house and to expand the veranda in his home.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda, 63 years old, is married and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past thirty years, Gilda has operated a food market business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of spices and vegetables to sell in her stall. In the future, Gilda would like to save enough money to support her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of spices and vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida, 41 years old, is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past six years, Loida has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Loida has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan through NWTF to further build her business. She will use her PHP 13,000 loan to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. In the future, Loida would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Nurila

texts.en:
Nurila, 43 years old, is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 3 years, Nurila has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Nurila has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. Nurila has previously borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Junia

texts.en: Junia, 53 years old, is married and has four children, two of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past four years, Junia has operated a retail clothing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to wear clothing to sell. In the future, Junia would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Olger Danilo

texts.es: Olger Danilo, tiene la edad  de 57 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa, la cual su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Olger Danilo is 57, married and lives with his wife who is his top priority.  With this loan he intends to purchase fertilizers and other products for his coffee crops so that they will develop well. He also plans to pay workers to apply the products and help him with the plants once his harvest begins to develop.  This way he will be certain that he will do a good job.  Older hopes to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions in the region as well as his many years of experience in growing coffee.  

In addition to being able to purchase better products, he will be able to ensure that his crops will develop well, have an adequate harvest and a solid production.  With the earnings from his harvest he plans to contribute to his family's wellbeing, complete some household goals, and continue to invest in his crops.  This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, before this, he had never had a loan from a bank. However, FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with great ease and a low interest rate.

loans.use: care for his coffee

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 1 child. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open other business branches within 5 years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en: Adelfa, 46 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. Adelfa works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 3 years, Adelfa has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, salt, home care products and other groceries to sell. In the future, Adelfa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, salt, home care products and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita, 45 years old, is married and has nine children, six of them in school. Amelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Amelita has been in this business for 10 years and has previously borrowed once from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 22-year-old student, majoring technology of educations. 

Haneen is a single lady and lives in Irbid with her family.  Her father is not able to cover her university fees because he is retired and his pension is not enough to cover all the needs of his family, therefore Haneen decided to apply for the loan to be able pay her semester fess. Her future plan is to finish advanced studies.

loans.use: To pay for her university fees in technology of education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Dolorita

texts.en: Dolorita, 50 years old, is married and has six children, two of them still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 20 years, Dolorita has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more varieties of fish to sell. In the future, Dolorita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fish to sell

loans.name: Febrero Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (AURELIA, IVANIA y MARICELA), originarias de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 3 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana,  para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

IVANIA: Es la coordinadora del grupo Solidario Febrero, es una joven de 25 años de edad, con cualidades de líder y deseos de superación, casada con 2 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como pescador artesanal. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos básicos como arroz, aceite, jabón, está solicitando  financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada. Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of three members (Aurelia, Ivania and Maricela), natives of the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They got together three months ago with the goal of working together to access loans from Pana Pana to have the opportunity to improve their businesses and thereby improve the quality of living for their families.

Ivania is the coordinator of the "Febrero" communal bank. She is a 25 year old youth with leadership qualities and the desire to get ahead. She is married with two minor children. Her husband works informally as a small scale fisherman.

She opened a small store three years ago with the objective of having her own source of income. She sells basic products like rice, oil and soap. She is requesting financing to diversify her products buying a bale of used clothing in Managua. She dreams of having a large and prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing in Managua to diversify her products.

loans.name: Eliana Group

texts.en:
Eliane is the featured borrower for Eliana Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Eliane is a 20-year-old single Syrian lady who started six years ago working as a hairdresser from her house to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consists of two members. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy acrylic nails materials and make ups to satisfy her customers' requests. 

Eliane is the lady sitting in the middle. Jamila is the first lady on the right, and Sabrine is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy acrylic nails materials and make up to satisfy her customers' requests

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a married woman, with 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, cabbages, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en: Nanette, 43 years old, is single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past seven years, Nanette has operated a retail frozen food business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen food to sell. In the future, Nanette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en: Bernarda, 58 years old, is married and has four children, one of them in school. Bernarda works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, Bernarda has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, home care products and other groceries to sell. In the future, Bernarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, home care products and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol, 30 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 5 years, Carol has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Carol would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Aied

texts.en:
Aied is a young man in the prime of life.  He is 25 years old and is a student at the university majoring in Industrial Engineering.  For as long as his family wanted to see him become a successful engineer in the future.  But financial difficulties faced by his family was an obstacle to completing his dream, so he had to postpone semesters, because he could not pay the fees, which led him to the delay at the university.

 Therefore Aied decided to a request an educational loan so that he can pay his university fees and complete his road to achieve his dreams

loans.use: To pay For his university fees in Industrial Engineering

loans.name: Flor Arely

texts.es: Flor tiene 25 años de edad y vive junto a sus padres y tres hermanos de 20, 16 y 15 años de edad. Flor por ser la mayor de cuatro hermanos es una mujer que desde muy joven  se dedica a realizar oficios varios y de esta manera poder ayudar a sus padres para que no falte nadar en el hogar y brindar a su familia una vida digna. Flor obtuvo un crédito anteriormente para dar inicio a la construcción de su vivienda y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida pero dado a que el monto solicitado no le fue suficiente y debido a que no cuenta con las facilidades económicas para seguir construyendo solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI y con el monto otorgado poder comprar: ladrillo, arena, hierro y cemento para continuar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en: Flor is 25 years old and she lives with her parents and three siblings, aged 20, 16 and 15. Because she is the oldest of four siblings, Flor is a woman who  since she was very young has worked at different jobs. This is how she has been able to help her parents so that nothing is lacking in the home, and give her family a dignified life. Flor obtained a loan previously to start construction on her home and give her family a better quality of life, but since the amount she asked for wasn't enough, and because she doesn't have the financial ability to continue building, she is asking for a new loan from FUSAI. With it, she will buy bricks, sand, iron, and cement to continue building her home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, iron and cement to continue construction on her home.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be goal oriented. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking oil, wheat, maize flour, bread, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, bread and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, bread and other items

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, cabbages, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes,onions and other vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes,onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en: Ammie, 44 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. Ammie works very hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Ammie has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, sugar and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. In the future, Ammie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en: Anabel, 40 years old, is married. For the past ten years, she has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, school supplies and other personal care products. Anabel has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. In the future, Anabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine hopes to have a nice and profitable with Kiva and she is just impatient to start it. She lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. She lives here with her two sons and mother-in-law. Kristine’s husband is working in the Russia. 

Kristine has specialty of nurse but she never worked in that sphere. So now she is very skilled farmer and she has cows, bulls, a calf, pigs, sheep and chickens  which she care very properly, in order to some constant income for her family. 

She is master also in potato cultivation which she sells very quickly. So this loan she hopes to use for her potato cultivation development. She will buy new sorts of potato seedlings, fertilizer and some fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy new sorts of potato seedlings, fertilizer and some fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 24 years old single lady living with her family in Mafraq. She is a university student majoring in English Languages and she is in her last year. Her father is retired with low income. 

Alaa is aiming to also find a job in her study field after graduating. She is now asking for your help to pay for her upcoming semester fees by applying for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her semester fees in English Language for her final year

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 41 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 4 year. not yet go to school. owns shop and he is in a business for the past 4 years. While his wife is a business woman. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more toothpaste, biscuits and salt and more for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. In future, he aims to earn at least 200,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more toothpaste, biscuits and salt etc for sale.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 51, married and has 5 children. 

He is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to start a fattening project and then selling, in a area he prepared near his house for the project.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle for fattening and then selling

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en: Hatem, 24 years old, is an example of an ambitious guy. He lives in Irbid with his family, which consists of 9 members. Hatem is studying in his fourth year of his bachelor's degree in accounting. Hatem is applying for an education loan to help him to cover the rest of the semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his university fees

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge sin hijos a su poder, en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Colasay que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Irma se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Irma espera ofrecer un arroz de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Irma is 41 years old. She lives with her spouse and without any children under her care in her own home, built from brick. It is in the district of Colasay, located in the province of  Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern sierra of  Peru.  Life is peaceful in this district. The residents mainly work in agriculture, trade and livestock.  

Irma works in agriculture, specifically, growing rice. She has 10 years' experience and very good personal and work references in the area. The loan she will be granted will be used to buy compost and fertilizer to do sufficient maintenance on her rice crop, as well as to hire labor for harvesting season. With this, Irma hopes to offer a better quality rice to her customers, which will have a positive impact on her income level and therefore improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to do sufficient maintenance on her rice crop.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is 27, married and has 3 children. He started a grocery store project along with his brother who suffers from a physical disability and is married. 

Nabil previously requested 4 consecutive loans and successfully repaid them on due dates. He requested another loan (15,000 EGP) to buy grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to expand his project and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy grocery products for his store such as oil, rice and pasta.

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Clara  está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Laura, quien se dedica a la venta de Comidas, Gaseosas,  y otros, ella en su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró estar en una situación de pobreza extrema, luchando por poder mejorar cada día. Laura es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia con su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como también de gaseosas y otros insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group Santa Clara is in their fourth cycle of the program 'comité de mujeres' [women's committee] in which everyone works and helps each other to succeed. They are doing the Poverty Stoplight program, fighting to be able to improve their life conditions and those of their families. 

One of the members is Laura, who works selling foods, soft drinks, and other goods. In her survey from poverty elimination she showed herself to be in a situation of extreme poverty, struggling to be able to improve every day. Laura is a very determined and hardworking person who wants to improve her life conditions and help her family with her work.

She is seeking this loan to be able to buy supplies to make her foods as well as soft drinks and other supplies to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing. She expresses her gratitude for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make foods, as well as soft drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children, two of whom in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, coffee, sardines, soft drinks, eggs, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane.

Melanie dreams that one day She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, coffee, sardines, soft drinks, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 71 years old and widowed with four children. Haide works very hard to provide for them.

Haide runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other groceries to sell.

Haide has been in this business for 15 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Luisa is 51 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Luisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jimmylyn

texts.en:
Jimmylyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jimmylyn is 37 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Jimmylyn has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Jimmylyn requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo sticks, nipa leaves, strings and other materials for her business.

Jimmylyn has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo sticks, nipa leaves, strings and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nenita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 39 years old and has four children are presently in school.

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a Kiva borrower and she describes herself to be entrerprising. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are busy. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en:
Abdul Rahman is a 21-year-old single Syrian man who started two years ago working in a restaurant to cover the needs and expenses of his family that consists of five members. He is an ambitious man, who is, despite his limited salary, working hard to gain experience so that he can open his own restaurant in the future. 

Today, Abdul Rahman is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to complete his resident permit documents. He hopes to achieve his dreams in the future and stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to complete his resident permit documents

loans.name: Badran

texts.en:
Badran is 47 years old and is a married man with five children  and he did not complete his education.
Badran started his business which is barber shop located on busy street. He first started as an assistant in one of the barber shops but after his children became bigger and their needs are increasing he decided to open his own kiosk.
 
The requested loan is to pay for new products and tools to increase the quality of his work and to expand his shop to attract more customers.
Badran, dreams that his children grow up with a good education and that they obtain good jobs so that they have a good quality of life.

loans.use: To buy new tools and materials and what he needs to improve his barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more motorcyclist in order to earn more.

loans.name: Khurisheed

texts.en:
Khurisheed is 43 years old. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. 

Khurisheed is well known among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase good-quality clothing of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to improve her clothing output

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Soad is 47 year’s old lives in Baqaa, married woman and has four children. One of them is Ammar who is studying physics and he appears in the photo instead his mother because she is conservative woman.  He is 22 years old and in in his third year in university with good marks. 

Soad wants the best for her son.  She wants to see him successful and depend on himself. But her income is not enough to cover his son education fees, so she applied for an education loan to help him cover Ammar`s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s third year university semester fees in Physics

loans.name: Hamest

texts.en:
Hamest is 57 years old and she lives in Geghamavan village of Gegharkunik region. This woman has big and nice family; she lives with her daughter-in-law and four grandchildren. Her son is in Russian Federation working abroad and from there he transfers money for his big family's endless needs. 

Hamest greatly helps her son and she solves their family’s financial needs through her farming and agricultural activities. She has cows, calves, a heifer, pigs and a lot of chickens in her farm. She cares of these all animals very properly and her farm products are also of very great assortment and good quality. She sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, butter, meat and eggs. Hamest also sells her land’s potato and tomato. 

Being very active and laborious woman she does every possible to develop her farm and have better income for her family. With this Kiva loan she wants to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and also fodder for all her cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and also fodder for all her cattle

loans.name: Alik

texts.en:
Alik lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Alik is married and he has 4 daughters and a son. His son now is passing his military service at the army and his daughters are married already. With his wife Alik is busy with farming which is the only source of income for his family.

 In his farm he has cows, calves, heifers and also a lot of chickens. As Alik mentions he perfectly sells meat (beef and poultry) from his farm. He cooperates with local butchers and he always manages to have good order of meat sale. The sale of dairy-products, such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese and curd is on his wife’s duty. So together this couple works hard but with great pleasure they earn on their family living.

Alik asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams as he wants to enlarge the number of his farm cattle and he plans to buy one more cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to enlarge the number of his farm cattle and he plans to buy one more cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 37 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 6 and 11 year. They all go to school. 

He sells owns shop and he is in a business for the past 4 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan, he would like to buy more toothpaste, biscuit and salt etc for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. In future, he aims to earn at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more toothpaste, biscuits and salt etc or selling.

loans.name: Saadiya

texts.en:
Saadiya is a widowed woman with no children and lives with her family. She has opened a market in her house for many years ago, she is selling general products and food supplies and also she works in freezing vegetables for sale.  

She is very productive woman and wants to depends on herself. She is asking for a loan to buy more products to sell and to add cleaning materials to her work to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy products that she want to sell and start the expansion phase.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a resident of Dumanjug, Cebu. She is a 57-year-old married woman. Her husband works abroad, on a ship while Edna attends to her restaurant, known locally as "carenderia". She sell pork stew, fish soup, fried fish, noodles and sauteed vegetables.
