She is asking a loan buy ingredients like seasoning, condiments, meat, vegetables and pay for tuition fees of her youngest child aged 17. Her income will be utilized for healthy meals, savings and reinvestment in the same business. 

Edna only dreamed of seeing all her children educated and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like seasoning, condiments, meat, vegetables and pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Soka

texts.en:
Soka is a 22-year-old married woman with no children, who resides in the Siem Reap province in Cambodia. Her husband is a 24-year-old construction worker, earning USD8 each day and he has worked in construction since 2010. 

Soka would like to build a new house but she lacks the money to buy lumber, so she is now applying for a loan. This loan will help her have enough money to buy lumber to build a proper house and live in better conditions. In the future, she wants to run the business selling groceries.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a new house

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes. Her business goal is to open other business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and married with five children, four of which are still in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and etc

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 56 years old and he lives with his wife in Kapan city of Syunik region. Their two sons are already married and they lives separately with their families. Gevorg now is seriously engaged in rabbit breeding in his farm. He sells the meat to the local restaurants and fast food cafes. 

He also has a nice orchard where he has cherry, persimmon and nuts trees and these harvest with his wife he sells at the local wholesale market.  Gevorg mentions that his orchard has problem of watering and he will be thankful if Kiva lenders support him to buy water tank and he also wants to install water pipes for watering his orchard equally and properly.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and he also wants to install water pipes for watering his orchard equally and properly

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing  business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from lodging house and buy and sell charcoal and general store. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to  purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing  business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Hernan Wilson

texts.es: Hernan tiene 26 años de edad es casado tiene 2 hijos, viven en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad El Castillo, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Ally Ñan, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo e invertir en el negocio para mejorar la economia su sueño es comprase un camión su desafio es la competencia y en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Hernan is 26 years old, married, and has two children. They live in the community of El Castillo in Guaranda in Bolivar Province. He belongs to the Ally Ñan rural service point and his occupation is buying and selling animals.  

Hernan is asking for a loan for working capital to invest in the business and improve its finances. His dream is to buy a truck and his challenge is the competition. He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to obtain working capital.

loans.name: Joesiemay

texts.en:
Joesiemay is 29 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Joesiemay has a general store business in the Philippines. Joesiemay requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Joesiemay has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Joesiemay would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 51 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Roselyn has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Nayel

texts.en:
Nayel is married and has three children. After he retired from his work he decided to open his own business which is grocery.
He started a small project to sell food supplies and general products so his income has become better, Nayel wanted to develop the project to expand it and add more sections in his market.
Nayel did not want to stop at this point he wants to develop and expand his shop, he asked for a loan to able him expand his shop and buy new products and to do good promotion to attract more customers, Perhaps this will help him to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: to able him expand his shop and buy new products and to do good promotion to attract more customers

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 41 years old and married, and has two children who are in school.

Rizalina is in the agricultural business, raising turkey in the Philippines. Rizalina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her business.

Rizalina has been raising turkey for 10 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rizalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 47 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. For the past ten years she has run a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Marina has applied for a 9000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy inventory to sell such as eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries. She is working hard to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her sari-sari, or general store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 57 years old and married with 12 children. With 3 children in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosalina has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Candelaria has a retail beverages business in the Philippines. Candelaria requested a PHP 5500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more beverages to sell.

Candelaria has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Candelaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 27-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee. Due to the limited access of Palestinians in Lebanon, he opened lately car accessories shop to cover his needs and expenses. He gained six years of experience in this domain from his brother.
 
Today, Mahmoud is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business through increasing his merchandise with new car accessories to satisfy his customers' special requests. 
Mahmoud hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with more car accessories to satisfy his customers' special requests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay down payment of motor cycle

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 25 years old, single and has a child to provide for. She fishes to earn a living and owns her own fishing boat.

As a single mother, Ruth is always aiming to earn more money. She has applied for a 5,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner GDMPC to buy an additional fishing net so that she can catch and sell more fish in the market. She is working toward buying a new and better fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old and he is married with 1 child aged 4. He sells foodstuffs and he is in a business for the past 6 years. While his wife is a business woman. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more sorghum, cassava and salt for sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. In future, he aims to earn at least 200,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum,cassava and salt for sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 48 years old and married. She has nine children, five of which are in school.

Emily is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a single man who has no kids.He rents a  house that  has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Francis operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, he sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. He faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to his place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a woman with great ideas and a creative mind. She is always looking for activities that can improve the family income. 
She decided to help her husband in the household expenses, she started her own simple business which is located in her house, she is making the cheese which is used it to make Arabic sweets and sell it for the sweet shops.

Najah is 55 years old and all her batteries were charged to take on the new challenges that life has prepared for her. 
She is requesting financial help to buy more products and more tools to help her to increase her products to sell and increase her incomes.

loans.use: To buy more tools and what she needs to produce a larger number of cheeses

loans.name: Nayfeh

texts.en:
Nayfeh is 37 years old and married with one child. Her child in the school and she is working very hard to provide for him.

Nayfeh runs a household supplies store in her house to help her husband in household expense, lately they faced financial problems lead Nayfeh is thinking about expand her store to increase her incomes, therefore she asked for a loan to help her buy more products to sell.

In the future, Nayfeh would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college, and open big store in her region

loans.use: To pay more household supplies to sell and increase her incomes

loans.name: Evelyn De Jesus

texts.es: Evelyn de 35 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su esposo de 38 años  y sus tres hijos de 16 años, 15 años y 8 años de edad. Evelyn desde ya hace un buen tiempo se dedica a la prestación de servicios varios lo cual le ayuda  y le permite llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y de esta forma dar a su familia lo necesario. Evelyn en su momento ya obtuvo un crédito que utilizo para poder  invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas para su hogar, debido a la buena experiencia ha tomado la decisión de  solicitar un nuevo crédito a  FUSAI para continuar las mejoras de su vivienda por lo que con el monto otorgado comprara: cemento, arena y grava para poder encementar el piso de su vivienda y así poder darle mayor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en: Evelyn, who is 35 years old, lives in a house that she owns with her husband and three children, who are 16, 15, and 8 years old. For some time now, Evelyn’s occupation has been providing several services, which helps her and allows her to bring daily sustenance to her home, and in this way give her family what they need. In another time, Evelyn has already received a loan which she used to invest in the purchase of doors and windows for her home. Thanks to the good experience, she has taken the decision to ask for a new loan from FUSAI to continue making improvements. With the given loan, she will buy: cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of her house and give more stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman and has1 child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a beauty salon. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to be will be a supplier of cosmetics within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Semillitas Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Paola es una joven mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años, y su negocio es el transporte.
Ella es buena madre,  optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Chasquipampa’ caracterizada por ser una antigua parada de los chaskis (en el tiempo del imperio inca), donde se hallan tumbas incaicas, cerámica y piezas de oro de esa época. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 3-17 grados centígrados.
Paola es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la primera de la derecha, viste cuello rojo). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus  hijos; el mayor esta iniciando la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, Viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el transporte libre como taxi; ella aprendió a conducir porque su padre le enseñó, actualmente cuenta con 1 auto propio que se encuentra en mal estado, con su trabajo paga los gastos de sus hijos y es independiente, “mi trabajo es libre, me da tiempo para atender a mis hijos y mi renta es diaria con eso pago todos los gastos del día…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la renta es diaria y puede pagar los gastos de sus hijos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de un motor nuevo para continuar con su labor. Su sueño es tener su casa propia con garaje para guardar su auto, ella desea realizar la compra de un motor de auto para continuar con su actividad y pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta Actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paola solicita un préstamo para la compra de un motor de auto para continuar con su actividad y pagar los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paola is 26 years old and lives with her life partner. She has two children who are 3 and 5 years old and her occupation is transportation. She is a good mother, has a good attitude  and is optimistic, happy, committed to her work, responsible,  and hard-working. She works in the Chasquipampa region which is known as an ancient stop for the Chaskis (Inca runners during the Inca Imperial times), and Inca tombs, ceramics and gold pieces from the period are found here. It has a cold and dry climate with temperatures that range from 3 to 17 degrees centigrade (37.4 - 62.6 F) during the daytime. 

Paola is short, stocky and has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears tied behind her neck. Her mother tongue is Aymará which she speaks with her family, but she speaks Spanish in public and for her business. She is the first one on the right with a red collar. She shares her life with her partner who works in commerce, and with her two children.  The elder one is just starting school, and the younger one is not yet old enough for school. They live in a rented room built of brick and cement with a tin roof and a wooden floor. It has electricity, drinking water and sewerage.

Her business is transportation such as taxi driving. She learned how to drive because her father taught her, and she currently has one car but it is in bad shape. Her work allows her to be independent and to pay her children's expenses. "My work schedule is flexible and gives me time to take care of my children, and I earn income every day so I can pay each day's expenses..." she states. These are the advantages of her work. The disadvantage is that there is not enough money for her to buy a new engine so she can continue with her work. 

Her dream is to have her own house with a garage for her car. She wants to be able to buy an engine for the car to keep working and paying her children's expenses. This is the first loan sequence with the institution in the three years that she has been running her business. These are the reasons why Paola is asking for a loan - to buy an engine for the car to keep on working and paying her bills.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her car.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
LAUREANA TIENE 47 AÑOS DE EDAD, MADRE SOLTERA, TIENE 01 HIJO DEPENDIENTE,VIVE EN EL CASERIO DE MAMACA QUE PERTENECE AL DISTRITO DE SAN FELIPE, PROVINCIA DE JAEN, REGION CAJAMARCA, SIERRA NORTE DE PERÚ. MAMACAES UN CASERIO MEDIANO, EN LA QUE LA POBLACION SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA, COMERCIO Y GANADERÍA.

LAUREANA SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO CUENTA CON UNA PEQUEÑA BODEGA UBICADA EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO LA CUAL VIENE FUNCIONANDO HACE MAS DE 05 AÑOS, TAMBIÉN SE DEDICA AL CULTIVO Y COMERCIO DE LIMAS CUENTA CON UNA FINCA DE LIMA CON BUENAS REFRENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SERÁ LA INVERSIÓN EN SU NEGOCIO CON LA COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA PARA AUMENTAR SU STOCK Y PODER ADQUIRIR UNA UTILIDAD ACEPTALE PARA QUE MEJORE SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Laureana is 47 years old. She is a single mother and has one dependent child. She lives in the town of Mamaca, which belongs to the San Felipe district in the Jaen province of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. Mamaca is a mid-size town, and the population works in agriculture, trade, and cattle farming.

Laureana works in trade, and has a small grocery store located in her own home that has been operating for five years. She also earns a living by growing and selling lemons. She has a lemon farm and good personal and work references.

She will use the loan to invest in her business and buy merchandise in order to increase her inventory and be able to reach an acceptable serviceability that will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 48 years old and has four children. Soledad is married and has two children who are in school.

Soledad is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Soledad requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Soledad has been in this business for 22 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Soledad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
This is Betty and her daughter Lady Lyn, who is seventeen years old and the sixth of seven children in the family. Lady Lyn is studying to earn a Bachelor’s degree in Secondary Education and is currently in the second year of this four-year program.

Betty fishes to help support the family and is a member of NWTF. She is borrowing 6000 PHP to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Lady Lyn plans to help her family and support the education of her brother and sister.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man  with four children  whom three attend school and the other one is still young. He lives at his own house that has electricity and piped water. His monthly expense is school fees.

He has operated a machine shop for the past 18 years. He  mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in his place of operation.With the loan  he wants to purchase some machines and parts for resale. He contacted Yehu to access loan facilities and boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase some machines and machine parts for resale

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a divorced woman and has two children. She has owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a fruit and coconuts selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation and seasonality in  her place of operation.

With the Ksh 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 47 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school. For the past nine years she has sold charcoal to earn an income. She also runs a sari-sari (a small general store in the Philippines) and operates a motorcycle transport service. She works hard to provide for her family.

Leonila has borrowed and successfully paid off ten prior loans from Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 11,000 PHP loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She is working to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Qais

texts.en:
Qais is a university student majoring in Hotel Management.  He decided to study this major because he dreams to be a manager in one of the big hotels. He believes that the success in the work stems from loving his work.

Qais needs a financial support to achieve his dreams, therefore he applied for an educational loan to help him cover his university fees and complete his road.

loans.use: To pay for his university fees in Hotel Management

loans.name: Dromo Naa 2 Group

texts.en:
The group Dromo Naa 2 brings together seven women who are active in business and practice the same activity such as soft drinks, foodstuff, frozen foods, materials, assorted sandals, wax print and second hand clothing. They will receive financial support through a partnership between their group and ID-Ghana.

The representative named Mary is 50 years old, and a married mother. She has been selling foodstuff like cassava, plantain, fish, vegetables etc. for the past 23 years. Mary will need a capital of GHS 3,000 with which she will buy cassava, plantain, fish, vegetables etc. for resale. She buys and sells foodstuff like cassava, plantain, fish, vegetables etc. to customers. 

She will be able to increase her working capital, profit and take care of her children very well. She together with her friends are asking for a total loan amount of GHS 8,600 and will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy cassava, plantain, fish, vegetables etc. for resale.

loans.name: Hilibrando

texts.es:
Hilibrando tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Hilibrando se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 14 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Hilibrando espera ofrecer un arroz de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hilibrando is 41 years old, and lives with his spouse and two young children in a house they own made of rustic material in the district of Pomahuaca, which is located in the province of Jaen, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in the area is quiet, the citizens work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. 

Hilibrando works in agriculture, specifically rice crops, he has 14 years of experience in the area and very good personal and professional references in his zone. He will use the loan to purchase manure and fertilizer to give good maintenance to his rice crops, and to hire workers in the time of the harvest. This way, Hilibrando hopes to offer better quality rice to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level, and therefore improve his quality of life and of his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to give good maintenance to his rice crops.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

He operates a television, radio repair business. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy television, radio repair parts. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy television, radio repair parts

loans.name: Normetha

texts.en:
Normetha is 48 years old and married with ten children. For the past thirty years she has operated a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines, as well as a vulcanizing shop.

Normetha has borrowed and successfully repaid a prior loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, school supplies, home care products and other groceries.

Normetha works hard continuously to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her sari-sari, or small general store

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Emiliana works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending.  Emiliana is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal to resell.

Emiliana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 41 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Mary Ann has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles and other personal care products to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Plata Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está conformado por 3 mujeres muy emprendedoras (ANA MARIA, LESBIA BENITA y RAQUEL) que se organizaron recientemente, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

LESBIA BENITA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario PLATA, es una joven luchadora de 28 años con cualidades de líder y deseos de superación, madre soltera de 2 menores de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 3 años vende de manera ambulante productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogos. Esta solicitando financiamiento para diversificar su negocio y comprar en Managua: Cadenas, aretes, pulseras, anillos, brazaletes, dijes, entre otros productos de plata y acero. Ella sueña con tener su propio tramo, donde pueda exhibir sus productos en vitrinas de vidrio.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 3 enterprising women (Ana Maria, Lesbia Benita and Raquel) who organized recently in order to access funding to improve their living conditions, meet the basic needs of their homes, ensure the education of their children, and expand their businesses.

Lesbia Benita is the coordinator of the group PLATA. She is a young, tenacious 28 year old with qualities of a leader and a desire to excel. She is single mother of two younger children. In order to raise her family, for the last 3 years she has sold beauty products and cosmetics on foot through catalogs. She is asking for her first loan to diversify her business and purchase chains, earrings, bracelets, rings, pendants, and other silver and steel products in Managua. 

Her dream is to have her own place, where she can showcase her products in glass display cases.

loans.use: to diversify her business and purchase chains, earrings, bracelets, rings, pendants, and other silver and steel products in Managua.

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr: Pour Cesia, la riziculture est une activité très rentable car grâce à elle sa famille a pu les scolariser et améliorer leur habitat. Initiées par leur maman, elles cultivent aussi afin de trouver le nécessaire pour remplir leurs devoirs des parents vers leurs dépendants. Pourtant, elle souligne que les maladies de plantes et l'insuffisance de moyens financiers constituent les obstacles de cette activité.
texts.en: For Cesia, growing rice  has been a profitable business since thanks to this work that her parents were able to pay for her children's schooling and improve their living conditions. Now, having been introduced to the work by their mother, Cesia and her siblings in their turn do whatever necessary to fulfill their obligations as parents. Cesia points out that plant diseases and lack of financial means continue to present a challenge for her business.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of labor, fertilizers and crop protection products.

loans.name: Pilita

texts.en:
Pilita is 37 years old, married and has one child in school. For the past three years she has sold food she makes herself.

Pilita has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more ingredients for the food she makes and sells. She is always working to improve her business and so secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for the food she makes and sells.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Angela tiene 43 años de edad es casada tiene 7 hijos vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad El Castillo, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la compra de ganado, solicita el credito para invertir en el negocio realiza las compras en Guaranda , su sueño es que mejore su negocio y extenderse, el desafio al que se enfrenta es la competencia, y en su tiermpo libre le gusta dedicarse a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angela is 43 years old, married, and has seven children.  She lives in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province, in the El Castillo community.  She makes a living in agriculture by buying livestock.  

She requests the loan so that she can invest in her business by making her purchases in Guaranda.  Her dream is to improve and expand her business.  The challenge she faces is competition.  In her free time she likes to devote herself to her children.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Benda

texts.en:
Benda is 47 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school. Benda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Benda has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Benda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas and cassava to sell

loans.name: Paola Rosario

texts.es:
Paola es una mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 9 años y su negocio es la venta de zapatos por catálogo.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona noroeste de la ciudad, donde el comercio es la principal actividad, llegando a tener un movimiento económico superior a los 500 mil dólares por día. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Paola es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que estudia en la escuela, Viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de zapatos por catálogo bajo el sistema de venta directa, sin horarios de trabajo ni jefes, con un sistema de negocio de contado, “actualmente el trabajo tradicional no permite realizar simultáneamente otras actividades, la venta directa me permite disfrutar tiempo con las personas que quiero...” comenta. Paralelamente a su actividad de venta de zapatos, ella trabaja como cajera de banco, realizando el horario continuo de 9 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde. La ventaja de su negocio es que lo realiza en sus horas libre y no se cruza con su trabajo de cajera, la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de zapatos por catálogo para aumentar su capital y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paola solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos por catálogo para aumentar su capital de trabajo y con los beneficios cuidar a su hija.
texts.en:
Paola is a 30-year-old woman, single, and she has a 9-year-old daughter. Her business is the sale of shoes by catalog. She is a good mother, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible, and a very hard worker. She does her business in the northeast part of the country, where commerce is the main activity, achieving an economy above 500 thousand dollars a day. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature which changes during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 
Paola is brown-skinned, has dark eyes, long black hair which she ties behind her neck, low height, and a slim physique. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish as general culture and because of her business. She shares her life with her daughter, who goes to school. They live in a rented room made of adobe with a calamine roof and wooden flooring, which has electricity, potable water, and a sewage system. Her business is the sale of shoes by catalog under the system of direct sales, without fixed schedules or bosses, with a payments system, “currently, traditional work does not allow to simultaneously do other activities, but direct sales allows me to enjoy time with the people I love…” she says. Next to her occupation of shoe sales, she works as a cashier at a bank, working from 9 to 5. The advantage of her business is that she can do it in her free time and does not interfere with her cashier work. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in her business. She wants to do the shoe sales to increase her capital and improve her sales. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in 2 years of having this occupation. 
It is for these reasons that Paola asks for a loan, for the purchase of shoes by catalog to increase her working capital and take care of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy shoes by catalog, increase her working capital, and take care of her daughter.

loans.name: Las Inseparables-Mutualista Group

texts.es:
Deyci es una mujer de 29 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de desayuno.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, amable, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Mutualista’; área central que aglomera a la mayoría de las oficinas públicas y privadas, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Deyci es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la izquierda, viste blusa celeste). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su esposo que trabaja en construcción y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar sus ingresos para pagar los gastos preescolares de su hijo la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en cerámica, venta de productos médicos naturales, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras y venta de bisutería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de desayuno como; tamales a la olla, que  es un rico preparado que, por lo general, se consumen a la hora de desayuno, aunque se puede comer a toda hora, según su elección. La receta es sencilla y está hecha a base de choclo, queso y si gusta leche,  “el truco que da un gusto diferente al preparado es la proporción apropiada de queso y manteca que se le mezcle…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los desayunos se venden a diario, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como; queso, choclo, leche, y otros. Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Deyci solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para vender desayunos y pagar los gastos preescolares de su hijo.
texts.en:
Deyci is a 29-year-old woman. She is married and has one 3-year-old child and her business is selling breakfast foods.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, independent, kind, consistent, responsible, and very hard-working. She performs her work in the 'Mutualista' zone; an area that includes the majority of the public and private offices. It has warm sub-tropical weather with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius during the day.

Deyci has a darker complexion, brown eyes, long brown hair that she ties up behind her neck, short in stature, and a thin physique. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish with the general public and in her business. She is seated on the left with the light blue blouse.

She enjoys her life in the company of her husband who works in construction, and with her son that is still not old enough to go to school. They live in a rented space made of bricks and cement with a tin roof and cement floors that has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

The need to improve her income to pay for her son's preschool expenses brought her to form a bank of people with businesses such as food sales, secondhand clothing sales, ceramic crafts, natural medicine sales, cosmetic sales, vegetable sales, and jewelry sales in order to request a loan to better their businesses.

Her business in the sale of breakfast foods such as boiled tamales, which is a delicious item that is generally eaten for breakfast, however you can eat it at any time depending on your preference. The recipe is simple, and is made with a base of corn, cheese, and if you'd like, milk. She says, "The trick to giving a different flavor to each batch is the amount of cheese and butter that you mix in." The advantage to her business is that breakfast is sold daily, and the disadvantage to her business is the lack of capital to buy cooking supplies such as cheese, corn, milk, and other items.

Her dream is to improve her income. She wants to invest in her business by buying cooking supplies. This is the first cycle of loans with the institution in the two years that she has been developing this business. For these reasons, Deyci is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies in order to sell breakfast foods and to pay for her child's preschool expenses.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies in order to sell breakfast foods and to pay for her child's preschool expenses.

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

NWTF is presenting Ma. Socorro's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Moises Isaias

texts.es: Moises tiene 22 años de edad es casado tiene 1 hijo y vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad El Castillo, el se dedica a ala compra y venta de ganado y solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo para invertir comprando ganado y obtener mayores ganancias, realiza las compras y ventas en la plaza de animales de Guaranda cada semana, su sueño es superarse y el sesafio al que se enfrenta es la competencia en el comercio y en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Moises is 22 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province, and the community of El Castillo.  He makes a living through buying and selling livestock.  

He requests the loan in order to have working capital so he can buy cattle and get better profits.  He makes his purchases and sales in the animal market in Guaranda each week.  His dream is to better himself.  The challenge he faces is the competition in the trade.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to have working capital so he can buy cattle and get better profits.

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANANTIAL” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gloria es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artículos de plásticos, venta de salchipapa, venta de colchones, venta de pescado, venta de polleras, venta de faldas, venta de papa.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gloria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su mamá que es clienta de Pro Mujer. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artículos de plástico para el hogar; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana hace más de tres años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de jarras, tazas y platos de plástico por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella soltera.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
This is the "Manantial” group's fourteenth loan with Pro Mujer as part of the "Centro Focal" of Alto Lima. The group is made up of ten members and is headed by a board where Gloria is the secretary. The members of the communal association have various businesses such as: selling plastic items, selling "salchipapa" (fried potatoes with hot dogs), selling mattresses, selling fish, selling "polleras" (skirts worn under outer skirts to combat the cold weather), selling skirts, and selling potatoes. 

The loan they are requesting will benefit microentrepreneurs of which Gloria is a member. She says that it's been a year since she joined Pro Mujer. Her mother is a member and she joined through her invitation. She currently has a business selling plastic home items. She learned this business over three years ago from her sister. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital (to buy jugs, cups and plastic plates) which she will buy from wholesale merchants in La Paz. She will then sell these in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate income to economically support her family since she is single. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings and health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy jugs, cups and plates wholesale.

loans.name: Angelica Beatriz

texts.es: Angélica de 22 años  de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida  y su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Angélica se dedica a la venta de pupusas de frijol con queso, chicharrón, de queso entre otras, ella es muy conocida en su comunidad pues elabora las pupusas más exquisitas y aun  buen precio del lugar donde reside además ofrece un excelente servicio a todos sus clientes, Angélica tiene varios años de trabajar en la realización de pupusas y gracias a los buenos ingresos económicos que obtiene ayuda junto con su compañero de vida a suplir las necesidades del hogar. Angélica es una mujer que siempre busca el bienestar de su familia y lo que le preocupa es que actualmente su piso es tierra y debido al polvo que se produce teme que dañe la salud de su familia provocando enfermedades respiratorias por lo que ha decidido adquirir un crédito en FUSAI que le permita invertir en la compra de cemento, grava y arena para encementar el piso de su vivienda y brindar mejor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Angélica is 22 years old and lives with her life partner and their young 3-year-old son. She works in the sale of pupusas [thick, stuffed corn tortillas]; bean and cheese pupusas, pork meat pupusas, and cheese pupusas, among other types. She is well know in her community as she makes the most exquisite pupusas, sells them at a good price from her home, and offers her customers an excellent service.

Angélica has worked in the making of pupusas for several years, and thanks to the good income she makes she helps, along with her life partner, to satisfy the needs of the household. She is a woman that is always looking for the well-being of her family. What bother her presently is the dirt floor of her home, due to the fact that she fears the dust it produces will have an adverse effect on her family's health, causing respiratory diseases.

It is for this reason that she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI, which will allow her to invest in the purchase of cement, gravel, and sand, so she can cement the floor of her house, and give her family greater stability.

loans.use: To buy cement, gravel, and sand, so she can cement the floor of her house, and give her family greater stability.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 47 years old and married with five children. With three of her children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like home care products, personal care products and other groceries.

Rowena has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like home care products, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Fausto De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Fausto de 48  años de edad, es casado y  vive  en su casa propia  con su esposa y sus  hijos,  se dedica a la actividad de la pesca y venta de Pescado, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 30 años y toda su vida la ha dedicado a este trabajo de la pesca.
Don Fausto vende peces como: palometa, ruco, lisa, pargo rojo y otros más,  es conocido en su aldea por ser una  persona luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante, y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.  
Don Fausto está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de 1 lancha nueva para la pesca, ya que el que tiene esta dañado y necesita comprar uno nuevo, con el apoyo de este préstamo desea mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Mayo del  2015.
texts.en:
Señor Fausto is 48 years old, married, and lives in his own home with his wife and children.  He makes a living by fishing and selling fish.  He has done this activity for 30 years, and his whole life has been dedicated to this job of fishing.

Don Fausto sells fish like Palometa, Raucus Grunt, Liza, Red Snapper, and others.  He is known in his village for being a hard-working person who has the desire to succeed, and he fights every day to improve his quality of life.

Don Fausto is requesting the loan in order to buy a new boat for fishing since the one he has is damaged and he needs to buy a new one.  With the support of this loan, he wants to improve his income and his quality of life.  He is a new customer wanting to work with Prisma.  

His dream is to improve his business and his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015

loans.use: to buy a boat for his business.

loans.name: Meshelle

texts.en:
Meshelle is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Meshelle is 31 years old and all of her children are in school.

Meshelle has a food vending business in the Philippines. Meshelle requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Meshelle has been in this business for four years. In the future, Meshelle would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a larger variety and quantity of underwear for women, men, and children, to increase her sales and income.

loans.name: Mirian Esthela

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 24 años de edad es soltera vive en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad El Castillo, se dedica al comercio de ganado, a la agricultura a la siembras de maíz, además se dedica a la  crianza de cerdos, pollos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar  ganado, semillas, urea para los sembrios. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los siembrios.
Ella estudia y quiere llegar a terminar sus estudios para ser una buena profesional.
El sueño es tener una casa propia.   Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Mirian is 24 years old, single, and lives in the city of Guaranda, Province of Bolivar, in the community of El Castillo [The Castle]. She works in the sale of livestock, in the sowing of corn, and in the raising of pigs and chickens.

She requests a loan so that she can buy livestock, seeds, and urea for the crops. With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase what she is missing for her crops.

Mirian currently studies, and wants to finish her studies so that she can become a good professional woman. Her dream is to have a home of her own. The challenges she faces are in the form of competition. In her leisure time, she likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, seeds, and urea for her crops.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura tiene 50 años y vive en la ciudad de México. Ella es una mujer responsable consigo misma y con los demás, desde hace mas de 20 años se ha dedicado a la venta de productos por catalogo, negocio con el cual saco adelante a sus 4 hijos, actualmente la madre de Rosaura depende de ella por que es discapacitada, necesita medicamentos y pañales. Con un préstamo de MXN 12000 Rosaura podrá comprar más productos para tener una oferta mayor y así poder ofrecer mas y mejores cosas a sus clientes. Uno de sus grandes sueños es estudiar cultura de belleza así como poder superarse económicamente, le gusta leer y escuchar música en su tiempo libre. Este es su primer préstamo con Konfío y agradece mucho por brindarle la ayuda, esta muy feliz por que se podrá superar con el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en: Rosaura is 50 years old, and lives in Mexico City. She is a responsible woman with herself and with everyone else. For more than 20 years, she has worked in catalog sales, a business with which she helped her 4 children get ahead. Currently, Rosaura’s mother depends on her because she is disabled, and needs medication and diapers. With a loan of 12,000 Mexican pesos, Rosaura will be able to buy more products to have a bigger supply, and be able to offer more and better items to her clients. One of her biggest dreams is to study beauty culture, and also improve herself economically. She likes to read and listen to music in her free time. This is her first loan with Konfio, and she is very grateful for this help. She is very happy because she will be able to succeed with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy more products by catalog and have a larger supply.

loans.name: Janik

texts.en: Janik lives in Varser village in the Gegharkunik region with his big family. He is 48 years old. Janik’s wife is unemployed and she takes care of their children and house. She also helps Janik about their farm. Janik has three children. Two of them are students and the smallest is just a year old little boy. So to manage to cover even the minimum needs of his family, Janik works very hard and he feels great hardships especially for his children’s education costs. Anyway, only through his farm does Janik manage to cover all these needs. Now on his farm he has cows, calves, a heifer, pigs, piglets, sheep, lambs and chickens.  With the goods that Janik cultivates (potatoes, tomatoes, greens and cucumber) and his farm products (milk, meat and eggs) this big and nice family happily lives in this small village. With this Kiva loan, Janik will be happy to buy fertilizer and diesel fuel for his land and fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and diesel fuel for his land and also fodder of his all farm cattle

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 60 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Natividad se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Natividad espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Natividad is 60 years old, he lives with his spouse and his children in a house that they own, made of rustic material, in the district of Pomahuaca which is located in the province of Jaen, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.  Life in this district is quiet, the citizens work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

Natividad works in agriculture, specifically in coffee crops. He has years of experience in the area, and has very good personal and professional references in the zone. The given loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to give good maintenance to his coffee crops, and also to hire workers during the time of the harvest. This way, Natividad hopes to offer better quality coffee to her customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level, and therefore improve his quality of life and of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to give good maintenance to his coffee crops.

loans.name: Mery Adelaida

texts.es: Mery tiene 26 años de edad es soltera vive sola en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad El Castillo, ella se dedica a vender productos de Herbalife que son productos naturales para la salud, solicita el crédito para invertir y mejorar su negocio, realiza las compras en Guayaquil, su sueño es ser empresaria y su desafio es el transporte, y en su tiempo libre hace ejercicios para mantener su figura.
texts.en: Mery is 26 years old, is single, and lives alone in Guaranda, a province of Bolivar in the community of El Castillo. She sells Herbalife products which are natural health products. She is requesting a loan to invest and improve her business. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil. Her dream is to be an entrepreneur and her challenge is transportation. In her spare time she exercises to maintain her figure.

loans.use: to invest in her Herbalife business.

loans.name: El Madroño Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario El Madroño, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (ANGELINA, BETTY y NANCY), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas; se unieron hace 4 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana  para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

NANCY: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora jovial, casada. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 1 año vende bastimento, en uno de los mercados de Bilwi, extiende un plástico negro para exhibir en las aceras sus productos. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar en el Territorio de Tasba Pri, en vocablo miskito significa tierra libre, se localiza aproximadamente a 50 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi: Coco, malanga, yuca, quequisque, frijoles, hortalizas, musáceas, plátanos, bananos, tubérculos, raíces, cacao, frutas, arroz y maíz, para venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con tener una finca y dedicarse a actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
The group "El Madroño" is composed of three enterprising women (Angelina, Betty and Nancy) who live in the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They got together 4 months ago in order to work in solidarity to access loans through Pana Pana to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses, increase their income, and improve the quality of life for their families.

Nancy is a member of the group. She is a good-natured, married woman. In order to have her own source of income, she has been selling products in one of the markets of Bilwi. She extends a sheet of black plastic on the sidewalk to display her products. 

She is requesting her first loan to make purchases in the territory of "Tasba Pri", a Miskito word that means free land, which is located approximately 50 kilometers from the city of Bilwi. She will purchase coconut, malanga (root vegetable), cassava, beans, vegetables, plantains, bananas, tubers, roots, cocoa, fruit, rice, and corn to sell to her customers at affordable prices in Bilwi. Her dream is to have a farm and engage in agricultural activities.

loans.use: to purchase coconut, malanga (root vegetable), cassava, beans, vegetables, plantains, bananas, tubers, roots, cocoa, fruit, rice, and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products and supplies to make nacatamales and to buy silver and steel products in Managua.

loans.name: Songa Mbele Mpunga Group

texts.fr: C'est depuis 1975 que Deri s'est lancé dans la culture du riz grâce à l'appui et à la formation de parents, voisins et amis. cette activité lui plait car elle n'est pas trop exigeante si l'on respecte les saisons et les conditions de semences utilisées. L'inondation, le manque d'eau et d'entretien font souvent obstacles à cette activité; Deri a l'ambition de diversifier les semences et accroitre le niveau de production. Avec l'aide de la PAIDEK, ils auront à élargir leurs champs pour ainsi avoir des grandes productions qui les permettront d'équiper leurs maisons et de construire. Président du groupe SONGA MBELE MPUNGA, il porte sur la photo une salopette bleue et tient un carnet rose dans sa main.
texts.en:
Deri has been growing rice since 1975 thanks to the support and training he received from his parents, neighbors, and friends. He likes this business as it's not too demanding if you respect the seasons and the specifics of the seeds that you are using. Floods, lack of water, and maintenance are the main challenges for this business. 

Deri would like to diversify the seeds he plants and increase his yield. With the help of PAIDEK, they will be able to grow their fields to have a bigger yield. This will allow them to outfit their homes and do construction on them.

Deri is the president of the SONGA MBELE MPUNGA group. He is wearing blue overalls and is holding a pink notebook.

loans.use: pay for hoeing, transplanting, labor, phytosanitary products, and harvesting.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 21-year-old single man living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. He is studying to get his bachelor's degree in child care and he is now in his third year. His father cannot cover Omar`s university fees because of the financial crises that he is facing. Therefore, Omar is applying for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. Omar`s future plan is to work in the same field.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал, 54 года, замужем, 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. У Нуржамал есть 15 коров, 50 овец. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуржамал обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Нуржамал будет использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nurzhamal is 54 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has a post-secondary education, and she works in agriculture. Nurzhamal has 15 cows and 50 sheep. 

In order to further develop her farm, Nurzhamal has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Nurzhamal will use the proceeds from her loan to develop her farm.

loans.use: to buy some sheep to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is 61 years old and a widow with three children. Yasmin works very hard to provide for them.

Yasmin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Yasmin has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future Yasmin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Saeb

texts.en: Saeb is a single man living in Irbid. He is studying to get his bachelor's degree in tourist management and he is now in his third year. The income that comes from his father’s job is income for his family. But recently, they are facing some problems that led Saeb to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. Saeb`s future plan is to work in the same field.

loans.use: to pay for his University fees.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 38, married to a laborer and has two children. She sews clothes to sell. Mariam is requesting a 4,000 EGP loan to buy a modern sewing machine and cloth to generate more income for her children.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine and cloth.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be kind. He operates a retail business where he sells building materials. He describes his challenge to be the lack of enough water. He will use the Kes 75,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya, from Vanadzor city in the Lori region, is very much thankful for her first Kiva loan and nice partnership, and greatly hopes that her second request will be accepted. Nataliya is a pedagogue with already 30 years of work experience. She graduated from Tbilisi Pedagogical State Institute, faculty of Russian Language and Literature and now she works at the school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. She also continues giving private courses in her subject and helps the pupils to get prepared for entrance exams. Nataliya lives with her father (he is a pensioner) and with her daughter. This time with her Kiva loan, Nataliya wants to buy a printer and take part in a paid course on computer skills in order to work easily with computers.

loans.use: to buy a printer and take part in a paid course on computer skills.

loans.name: Burulai

texts.ru: Бурулай, 28 лет, замужем. У нее среднее образование. На протяжении 5 лет в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается разведением скота. У Бурулай в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 10 овец, лошадь. На сегодняшний день деятельность Бурулай приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 16,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена построить сарай.
texts.en:
Burulai is 28 years old and married, and she has a secondary school education. Over the last 5 years, she has raised livestock as a source of income for her family. Burulai has 2 cows, 10 sheep and a horse on her farm. Her business currently brings in a monthly profit of 16,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further expand her farm, Burulai has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy purebred cows. She plans to use the proceeds from her loan to develop her farm, and intends to build a barn.

loans.use: to buy some purebred cows to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more computers for her Internet Cafe. It was indeed a milestone for her, especially because she was able to provide a better income for her family.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for the same reason. She would use this loan to maintain her computer shop and at the same time add more PC units to her current inventory. She hopes that your hearts will be touched and you will support her in her aim to be better.

Liberty hopes that her business will continue to expand and improve (e.g., air conditioning for the shop) and dreams to have a better house too. 

Liberty meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to maintain her computer shop and purchase more PC units for her inventory.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn, 35, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ailyn has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ailyn has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Khadijah

texts.en:
Khadijah is a married woman with two children. She is an amazing and hardworking woman. She wants to help her husband with the household expenses and the tuition fees for her children. She is really an example of a woman who has willpower. She started her business selling cleaning materials in her house.

She wants to expand her work and to increase her incomes to live comfortably with her family. Therefore, she requested a loan to buy more products to sell to increase her profits and be able to help her husband more and more.

loans.use: to buy more products and tools to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 64, is a widowed woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Jesus Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo es un joven de 25 años dedicado a la agricultura especialmente a la producción de  miel orgánica con más de 3 años de experiencia en el rubro, Arturo está casado y tiene un hermoso par de gemelos bajo su cargo, el quiere que cuando sean grandes puedan tener una buena educación y que nunca les falte nada.
La producción de miel orgánica es una actividad muy sostenible en la región ya que las condiciones climáticas son perfectas y la gran existencia de plantas hace que la producción sea abundante además la certificación orgánica garantiza un buen mercado por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual Arturo es socio.
En la actualidad Arturo solicita un crédito para poder sostener sus colmenas en la época de lluvias (No hay producción de miel por lo que hay que darles alimento de origen orgánico) y hacer algunas reparaciones en las cajas de las colmenas para evitar que las aguas lluvias lleguen a entrar a la colmena.
El crédito ayudara a Arturo a Mantener su apiario mientras llega la temporada seca e inicia la producción, con las ganancias de su producción de miel Arturo puede suplir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Arthur is a young man, 25 years old, who earns a living in agriculture, especially the production of organic honey, having more than three years of experience in the field.  Arthur is married and has a beautiful set of twins under his care.   When they are older, he wants them to get a good education and lack nothing.  
The production of organic honey is a very sustainable activity in the area since climactic conditions are perfect and the large number of plants makes production abundant; also organic certification guarantees a good market by means of COCAFAL, of which Arthur is a member.

Arthur is asking for a loan now to be able to support his hives in the rainy season. (There is no production of honey so that it's necessary to give them food of an organic origin).  He also asks for this loan is order to make some repairs in the boxes of the hives to keep rain water from entering.  The loan will help Arthur maintain his apiary until the dry season comes and production begins.  With the earnings from his production of honey, Arthur can supply his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy organic sugar to feed bees, organic medicines for the bees and other materials needed to maintain the apiary.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flours, eggs, food coloring, yeast, propane gas and butter to make bread in his bakery.

loans.name: Yoxaja 2 Group

texts.es:
Micaela es una mujer de 51 años de edad es casada, tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 20 y 25 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahualá. Micaela para poder obtener sus ingresos y darle lo mejor a su amada familia se dedica a la venta de café desde hace quince años, gracias a esta labor ha logrado cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Micaela con el afán de seguir prosperando con su venta de café ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, porque ella espera obtener una buena cosecha este año para incrementar sus ingresos.
El gran sueño de Micaela  es que sus hijos estudien y sean grandes profesionales para estar al servicio de la población.
texts.en:
Micaela is a 51 year old woman, who is married and has a lovely family of two children between the ages of 20 and 25 years.  This family lives in a
Nahualá community.  Micaela has worked at selling coffee for 15 years in order to obtain income and give to her beloved family.   Thanks to this work, she has been able to provide for the needs of her family.  Micaela, wanting to continue prospering with her sales of coffee, decided to seek a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and hand labor, because she hopes to get a good harvest this year to increase her income.

The great dream of Micaela is that her children will study and become great professional people to be at the service of people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Lulu is single and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Lulu requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Lulu has been in this business for five years now.

In the future Lulu would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 17 years now.

Alma has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Alma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Melagin

texts.en:
Melagin, 41, is married with two children, both of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Melagin has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Melagin would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 50 years old and has one child who is in school.

Gloria has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for four years. In the future Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. May is 48 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

May has a buy-and-sell native mats business in the Philippines. May requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of native mats to sell.
