May has been in this business for six years. May would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of native mats to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 52 years old and widowed with six children. With three children in school, Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Elisa has been in this business for 13 years. 

In the future Elisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Apostol Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “APOSTOL SANTIAGO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de abarrotes, venta de ropa, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de pasteles. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia con el poco ahorro que tenia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra aceite, fideo y azúcar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera  y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Apostol Santiago" communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle at Pro Mujer's regional office in Alto Lima. The group has eight members and is managed by a board of directors that has Delia as president. The members all have businesses selling different products, including: groceries, meals, sports clothing and cakes.

This loan will benefit small businesses in Delia's group. Delia herself says that she joined Pro Mujer following an invitation from a friend who was already a borrower. Delia currently has a business selling groceries and says that she started it under her own initiative with the few savings she had.

This loan will be used to increase capital at Delia's business by buying oil, pasta and sugar in bulk. Delia will buy these goods from sellers in El Alto, and then sell the goods at her own business. This work allows Delia to earn an income to support her family financially. Delia is single and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Delia says that she likes the health training offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy oil, pasta and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Charita works hard to support her family.

She has a food processing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Charita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more food to sell for her food processing business.

Charita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 59 лет, вдова, воспитала 3 детей. Она на пенсии, в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается разведением скота и полеводством, начав этот бизнес в 2002 году. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день, Гулнара имеет в хозяйстве 7 коров, 30 овец. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. На 3,20 Га земли выращивает фасоль. Деятельность приносит ежемесячную совокупную прибыль в сумме 29,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 59 years old, a widow, and has raised 3 children. She is on a pension, and she breeds livestock and grows crops as a source of income for her family. She began this business in 2002. Thanks to her very hard work, Gulnara now has 7 cows and 30 sheep on her farm. She sells milk on a daily basis, and she grows beans on 3.20 hectares of land. Her activities bring in a combined monthly income of 29,000 som (KGS).

In order to further expand her business, Gulnara has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy mineral fertilizers and a dairy cow to increase her volume of organic milk sales. Gulnara plans to invest the proceeds from her loan in the continued expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to cultivate her land and one dairy cow to increase her volume of organic milk sales.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали житель города Душанбе. Ему 40 лет. Он семейный человек. У него один маленький ребенок. Шерали заботливый и честный мужчина. Он имеет свой собственный бизнес, который ему приносят больше прибыль. Шерали печет самбусы, и продает напитки, комрот и пирожки. Он 4 года занимается своим бизнесом. У Шерали все отлично получается, он в течение 4 года привлечь себе больше клиентов. Сейчас лето и очень жарко, для напитков нужно холодильник для охлаждение. Шерали не смог копить денег для приобретения холодильника, и вынужден обратиться за кредитом. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет Шерали расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
Sherali is a resident of Dushanbe. He is 40 years old, and he is a family man. He has one small baby. Sherali is a caring and honest man. He has his own business, which brings him great profit. Sherali bakes samosas, and he sells drinks, compote, and pirozhki. He has run his business for 4 years. Everything is turning out excellently for Sherali, and he has attracted more and more customers over the last 4 years. 

Now it is summer and it's very hot, so drinks need to be cooled in a refrigerator. Sherali was not able to save the money to purchase a refrigerator, and had to apply for a loan. The requested loan will help Sherali expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to expand his business.

loans.name: Edith Jazmina

texts.es:
La joven Edith de 25 años de edad, es casada vive  en su casa con su esposo y su hijo,  se dedica a la actividad de reventa de pan como rosquillas y quesadillas, sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante ella va de casa en casa por la ciudad de Pespire y al rededores, es conocida por vender un excelente  producto y a buen precio y  también por ser una  persona luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante.
Doña Edith lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mas rosquillas y quesadillas y así tener más producto para ampliar sus ventas, con el apoyo de este préstamo desea mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente nueva con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Mayo del  2015.
texts.en:
Edith is 25 years old, married and lives with her husband and son. She works selling dough-based products such as pastries and quesadillas. Edith sells as a street vendor, going from house to house around the city of Pespire and its surroundings. Edith is known to sell an excellent product at a good price. She is also known for being plucky and for her desire to move ahead in life.

Edith works hard every day in order to improve her quality of life. She is applying for this loan in order to buy quesadillas and pastries and have more products to increase sales. Edith wants to increase her income and quality of life with this loan. She is a new borrower and wants to work with Prisma.

Edith's dream is to improve her business and her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras; May 2015.

loans.use: to buy quesadillas and pastries for her business.

loans.name: Darwin Omar

texts.es:
El señor Darwin Omar de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa tiene tres  hijos  que dependen de él y vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace  varios años  a la venta de ropa usada y nueva.
Don Darwin Omar su venta es ambulante en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo esto lo realiza en su motocicleta,  sus clientes le prefieren por sus buenos precios y variedad en sus productos, es un hombre trabajador y muy dado a su familia, quiere salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos también tiene un coche acarreado por caballo en donde vende otros productos como agua ya que debido a la sequia en la zona el vende bastante agua.
Don Darwin Omar está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de un fardo de ropa como blusas, vestidos, faldas, camisas, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende mejorar su negocio y su economía gracias a que viene  una buena época para su negocio y desea mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener  salud.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2015.
texts.en:
Darwin Omar is 43 years old, he lives with his wife and has three children who depend on him. He lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. He has his own home and his occupation for several years has been the sale of new and used clothing. 
He is a street vendor in the neighborhoods of San Lorenzo, and he does this on his motorcycle. His clients prefer him because of his good prices and variety of products. He is a hard-working man and very dedicated to his family. He wants to get ahead and improve his income. He also has a horse-driven cart which he uses to sell other products, such as water, as due to the drought in the area, he sells a lot of it. 
He is asking for a loan to buy a bundle of clothing, such as blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, etc. With the help of this loan, he intends to improve his business and his economy, thanks to the good time it will bring to his business and he wants to increase his income. His dream is to improve his house and to have health.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2015.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 21 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее неполное высшее образование, сейчас Гулмира в декретном отпуске, занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть корова и 10 овец. На 3,20 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу и фасоль. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на обработку почвы и дальнейший сбор экологически чистого урожая. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 21, married, and has 2 children. She has an incomplete college education, and is currently on maternity leave. Gulmira raises animals and grows crops, and she has a cow and 10 sheep on her farm. She grows corn and beans on 3.20 hectares of land. Her monthly profit is 15,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further expand her business, Gulmira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to cultivate her land and subsequently harvest organic products. She plans to invest the proceeds from her loan in the further expansion of her business and in the repair of her home.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and grow eco-friendly products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts, spandex, towels, lotions, creams, hair dyes, gelatin, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Zhyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан, 53 года, замужем, 4 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день прибыль Жылдызкан составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. У нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 5 овец, также на земельном наделе мерою 2,22 ГА она выращивает фасоль, которую реализует оптовым покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдызкан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрения и топлива для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически-чистой фасоли. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и покупку земельного участка.
texts.en:
Zhyldyzkan is 53 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a specialist secondary education, and she has done agricultural work for many years. Zhyldyzkan currently makes a profit of 13,000 som (KGS) per month. She has 4 cows and 5 sheep on her farm, and she grows beans, which she sells to wholesale buyers, on a plot of land measuring 2.22 hectares. 

In order to further develop her business, Zhyldyzkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer and fuel to work her land and grow organic beans. Zhyldyzkan plans to invest the proceeds from her loan in the continued development of her business, and plans to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fuel to cultivate her land and grow organic beans.

loans.name: Xenia Marili

texts.es:
La joven Xenia Marili de 26  años de edad, es casada vive  en su casa con su esposo y su hija,  se dedica a la actividad de venta de golosinas en general y en especial los famosos nacatamales de gallina y cerdos, también hace enchiladas, tacos, pollo frito, tortillas con quesillo, tajaditas y otros más, es conocida en su aldea por ser una  persona luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante,  lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.  
Xenia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, gallinas, refrescos y 1 juego de sillas con meza nuevas para atender mejor a los clientes que la visitan, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Uno de sus  sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio y que en un futuro sea uno de los negocios más grandes de la zona.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Xeni Marili is a young woman who is 26 years old. She is married and lives in a house she owns with her husband and her daughter. Her occupation is the sale of candy in general, and especially, the famous nacatamales (corn, meat, and rice wrapped in a banana leaf) made of chicken and pork. She also makes enchiladas, tacos, fried chicken, tortillas with cheese, fried plantains, and others. She is known in her village as a hard-working person with the dream of getting ahead. She makes an effort day to day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for this loan for the purchase of corn, chickens, sodas, and a new set of chairs and table, to better tend to the clients that visit her. She hopes this investment will allow her to get ahead in her business, and improve her quality of life and of her family. 
One of her dreams is to keep improving her business and that in the future it is one of the biggest in the area. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – May 2015

loans.use: for the purchase of corn, chickens, sodas, and one set of chairs and a table for her business.

loans.name: Victor Noel

texts.es:
El joven Víctor de 30 años de edad, es casado y  vive  en su casa familiar  con su esposa y su  hijo,  se dedica a la actividad de la pesca así como a la venta del mismo.
Víctor visita el mar desde hace 05 años,  consigue peses como, palometa, ruco, lisa, pargo rojo, etc. es conocido en su aldea por ser una  persona luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante, el joven lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.  
Víctor está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de repuestos para reparar el motor de sus lancha el cual está dañado y necesita ponerlo a trabajar,  con el apoyo de este préstamo desea mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Mayo del  2015.
texts.en:
Victor is a young man who is 30 years old, he is married and lives in his home with his wife and son. His occupation is fishing, as well as sales of the same product. 
Victor has been visiting the sea for 5 years, he gets fish such as harvest fish, raucous, mullet, snapper, etc. His is known in his village as being a hard-working person with the dream of getting ahead. The young man makes an effort day to day to improve his quality of life. 
Victor is asking for a loan for the purchase of replacements to repair the motor of his boat, which is damaged and he needs to get it working. With the help of this loan, he wants to improve his income and his quality of life. He is a new client with the desire to work with Prisma. His dream is to improve his business and his quality of life. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – May 2015.

loans.use: to buy replacements for a boat motor.

loans.name: Sarita Emely

texts.es:
Sarita, de 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, no continuo estudiando porque tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a elaboración matates y hamacas y actualmente vive en casa de sus padres.
		 
Sarita, empieza su día a las 5 de la mañana para alistar a sus hijos para que puedan ir a la escuela y también a hacer algunos oficios domésticos en la casa, luego en el transcurso del día realiza su principal actividad que es trabajar en la artesanía en la elaboración de matates y hamacas de hilo; desde pequeña se ha dedicado a este trabajo, pues es una actividad que iniciaron sus padres y ha sido trasmitida de generación en generación dentro de la familia.

No es nada fácil el rol que desempeña, pues su trabajo no es fácil especialmente porque tiene que trasladar la materia prima (cobo de hilo) hacia su casa, ella le compra a un distribuidor y luego tiene que cargarla en la espalda hasta su casa aproximadamente media hora y como no hay un medio de transporte hasta donde ella vive, se le hace bien difícil trasladarla hasta su casa. 

Gracias al financiamiento anterior logro superar sus expectativas de ganancias con la materia prima que compro  para trabajar en la elaboración de matates.- Ahora, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara 2 sacos de abono, fertilizantes y para pagar la mano de obra, dado a que le toca a ella sola cultivar la tierra, pues ella siempre se ha dedicado a cultivar milpa.

Sarita, sueña con poder ampliar más su negocio y colocar un local donde pueda emplear a personas que le ayuden a realizar los trabajos, también otro deseo que tiene es construir su propia casa, donde pueda vivir junto a sus dos hijos, pues por el momento vive junto a sus padres.
texts.en:
Sarita, 31 years old, is a single mother, has 2 children of 11 and 7 years of age, studied until 6th grade, but did not continue studying because she had to help her parents make bags and hammocks. Currently, she lives in her parent's house.

Sarita begins her day at 5 a.m. in order to get her children ready for school and also to do some household chores, then over the course of the day she performs her main source of work, which is the crafting and making of bags and roped hammocks. Since she was little she made a living doing this work, because her parents took up this trade and it has been transmitted from generation to generation within the family.

It's not easy to perform this role, due to her work not being easy, especially because she has to transport raw material (thread spools) to her home. She buys it from a distributor and then has to carry it on her back for approximately a half hour to her house. It is difficult to transport to her house as there is no means of transportation to where she lives.

Thanks to the previous financing of the raw materials that she buys for making bags, her earnings exceed expectations.

Now, with this new loan, she will buy 2 sacks of manure, fertilizers and pay for labor (because it is up to her to cultivate the land alone) as she has always made a living cultivating cornfields.

Sarita, dreams of expanding her business and to create a place where she is able to hire people to help her work. Also, another desire that she has is to construct her own house, where she will be able to live together with her children, because at the moment she lives with her parents.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of manure, fertilizer and to pay labor to cultivate.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Rose Mae

texts.en:
Rose Mae is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rose Mae is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rose Mae has a timber sales business in the Philippines. Rose Mae requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her sewing business.

Rose Mae has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rose mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her sewing business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Felomina dreams that one day, She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more poultry and he want to put air conditioner for the poultry to increase the fertility

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is studying in university majoring in law. He is a member from a big family and his father is retired with low pension which is not enough to cover all household expenses.
 
Lately his family faced financial crises, prevent them from paying for his university, therefore Ali decided to apply for an educational loan to help him paying for his university fees and achieve his dreams to become lawyer to help people who are oppressed.

loans.use: To pay for his university fees,majoring in Law

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is married and has four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishable of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a griddle for pupusas and a new pan to prepare the delicious products that she sells in her business.

loans.name: Jaina

texts.en:
Jaina is 32 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Jaina works very hard to provide for them.

Jaina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal product care, home product care, and other groceries.

Jaina has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Jaina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal product care, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar already once solved very important problem for her family by the help of Kiva loan and Kiva partnership and she hopes that she will have second chance. She lives with her family in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Gohar has three children, two sons and a daughter. She works as a baker and her husband is employed also as a constructor. 

Gohar’s smallest son is still a student and he studies at the paid division of the State Institute of Physical Education, in faculty of Weightlifting. So Gohar greatly hopes that this time again Kiva lenders will help with loan, so that she will be able to pay her son’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee in Physical Education and Weightlifting for the second semester

loans.name: Jumilyn

texts.en:
Jumilyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jumilyn is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jumilyn has a buy and sell jewelries business in the Philippines. Jumilyn requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more jewelries.

Jumilyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Jumilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry for sale

loans.name: Grimar

texts.en:
Grimar is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Grimar is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Grimar has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Grimar requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Grimar has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Grimar would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 34 years old, he is a single hardworking man. He is requesting for a school fees loan because to him, he finds it a challenge to pay the whole amount at once but given an opportunity, he could pay in installments. 

He is in a higher level institution called UR College of Education, it’s a private institution. He started his studies in 2012 and he plans to graduate in 2015.

loans.use: To pay his college tuition fees in Education in installments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more products and more vegetables and to expand her market to increase her work

loans.name: Zarine

texts.en:
Zarine lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Now she lives alone as her husband is in Russian Federation working abroad

 Zarine is a good farmer and in her farm she has cows, calves, lambs, sheep and chickens. She perfectly manages the care of all these and also the sale of her farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy-products), cheese and eggs. Zarine asks this loan as her farm cattle has lack of fodder and with this amount she wants to buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Jivan

texts.en:
Jivan is 50 years old and he lives in the village of Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region. Jivan is married and he has a son and a daughter. For several years Jivan worked as a locksmith, but then he fully became engaged in farming and agriculture. He does all the work around his farm with the help of his nice family, especially his son helps him in his farming activities very much. 

On his farm he has two cows, two calves, four sheep, two lambs and ten chickens. Jivan’s wife perfectly makes and sells Armenian national tasty cheese named 'chanakh' , and also macun (a national dairy-product), milk, meat and eggs. On his plot of land Jivan and his son cultivate potatoes, greens and tomatoes and they sell part of it to re-sellers. 

Now he decided to have with Kiva lenders as he needs to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer and also he wants to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer and also he wants to buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 47 years old and he lives with his wife and son in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Armen mentions that he feels lucky as he managed to find some job of his profession and he work with great pleasure and properly as he knows all the skills of his work. 

Having the proper education of tailor, Armen already 15 years works as a tailor at the private workshop. He also takes some orders at his house. He has his regular customers for whom he sews dresses, trousers, costumes and skirts. He works very cutely and since he does his work with pleasure the results satisfy both Armen and his customers. This loan Armen needs in order to buy wefts and also threads for his tailoring activities.

loans.use: to buy wefts and also threads for his tailoring activities

loans.name: Happiness Group

texts.en:
The happiness group consists of three ladies whose individual efforts and struggles encouraged them to join ID-Ghana for their four loan. They sell underwear, wigs, hair products. Felicia (standing in the middle of the photograph) is the group's representative borrower; she has been selling African underwear for 12 years. She is applying for this loan to buy more underwear to sell to customers. This will help her to finalize her business plan, and thus improve her income. 

The group members have received an orientation about loans and micro finance, so they are aware of the work and effort expected from them and required to ultimately be successful and provide a better life for their families. There is continuous training and verification provided that encourage the women to fight to escape poverty. The group needs a total amount of GHS 3,500 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad lives with his parents in Irbid; he is example for ambitious and positive guy.  Ahmad is 21 years old, university student majoring power and electric machines engineering, and he did not find a suitable work beside his education. 

He wishes to graduate to find good work to help his family in the household expenses and to carry responsible from his parents. Lately his father faced financial problems and he could not cover Ahmad`s university fees, therefore he decided to apply for an educational loan to pay for his university fees and achieve his goals.

loans.use: To cover his university fees in Power and Electric Machines Engineering

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is 42 years old and he lives with his family in Kapan city of Syunik region. Tigran is married and he has two school-aged children. 

Tigran is a driver with many years of work experience. For a long time he was made cargo transfers about his region. Now on his car he gives taxi services and he already has a lot of regular customers whom he drives from Kapan to Yerevan and back. 

Tigran bought the car in the photo lately and for this car he managed to pay only the half part. He asks this loan as he wants to pay the remaining half of the money for his car. He hopes for a nice partnership and thanks beforehand.

loans.use: to pay the remaining half of the money for his car

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, where she has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is a 47-year-old year old married mother of four children. She started eight years ago working as an accountant in a company to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Due to her limited salary and increasing living costs, Latifa decided to improve her family's living through starting her own business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open her own chicken rotisserie business and buy the necessary tools and materials.

Latifa hopes to succeed in this business and expand it more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to open her own chicken rotisserie business and buy the necessary tools and materials

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha  is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has no piped water but has electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past five years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. In addition she also operates  a cloth selling business.She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her two business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is divorced woman with five school going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes, where she has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of creditors not paying their debts in time.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Enso Nyame Ye Group

texts.en:
These members are part of a group made up of three members with an average age of 45 and, on average, two children. They live in traditional extended families in the district of Accra in the town of Chorkor-Accra. They got to know each other thanks to neighborly and business relationships and friendships. 

They joined the MFI ID-Ghana in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could do business better and are on their 11th loan. The ten previous loans have been correctly repaid. Vida, the group representative standing first from the left in the picture, sells smoked fish. She plans to use her loan to buy more fish, firewood, smoke fish and sell to customers. She makes her sales at the market, for cash, to mixed retail clients. She expects to make a good monthly profit, which she will use to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish, firewood, smoked fish and sell to customers.

loans.name: Wilman

texts.es:
Wilman es un agricultor de 35 años de edad, soltero y se dedica especialmente a la producción de café y miel orgánica, tiene más de 7 años de experiencia en la producción de miel orgánica y posee un apiario bastante amplio, Wilman tiene un hijo y su sueño es poder formar un pequeño patrimonio para que su hijo pueda tener mejores oportunidades.
La producción de miel orgánica es una actividad novedosa en la región ya que las condiciones climáticas son adecuadas y la gran existencia de plantas hace que la producción sea abundante y aunque Wilman tiene ya bastante tiempo en la actividad, las prácticas de la norma orgánica han hecho su apiario mucho más sostenible, ya que producir miel orgánica le da mejores oportunidades de mercado para el producto, a producir mas sin dañar a las abejas y a cuidar el ambiente con un apiario donde se llevan a cabo buenas practicas.
Actualmente Wilman solicita un préstamo para ampliar su apiario, el desea obtener alrededor de 30 colmenas mas lo que le ayudara a tener mejores ingresos para poder mantener todas sus necesidades y las de su hijo.
Un préstamo ayudara a Wilman a tener mejores ingresos y por lo tanto mejores oportunidades de crecer y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Wilman is a farmer who is 35 years old, he is single and works especially in the production and sale of coffee and organic honey. He has more than 7 years of experience in the production of organic honey and he owns a very large apiary. Wilman has a son and his dream is to form a small patrimony so that his son can have better opportunities. 
The production of organic honey is an novel activity in the region, as the weather conditions are adequate and the large existence of plants causes production to be abundant. Though Wilman has had this occupation for quite some time, the practices of organic rules have made his apiary more sustainable. Producing organic honey gives him better opportunities in the market for the product, to produce more without harming bees, and to take care of the environment with an apiary where good practices are put in place. 
Curretnly, Wilman asks for a loan to expand his apiary, he wishes to obtain around 30 more hives, which will help him to have a better income to be able to support all his needs, and those of his son.
A loan will help William to have a better income, and therefore better opportunities to grow and give a better quality of life to his son.

loans.use: to buy 30 hives for his apiary.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 53 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and six children, two of them are still attending school. Her husband is the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life and until now he earns a barely fair income. 

For that reason, today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register her children with the coming school year what makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Maria Mirtalina

texts.es:
La  señora  María de 53 años  de edad, vive en  su casa propia  con sus hijos que no dependen de ella, gracias a que trabajan es una madre soltera que lucho para sacar adelante a su familia, se dedica desde hace muchos años a la venta de tortillas, cosméticos y frescos y agua purificada.
Doña María  sus clientes  son amigos y vecinos que a diario le visitan para comprar sus tortillas estos le prefieren por su atención y buen trato, su casa está ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de cemento, arena, varillas, y laminas, materiales de construcción para mejorar el techo, corredor y baños de su vivienda, con el apoyo de este préstamo espera  poder lograr uno de sus sueños que es ver su casa re-modelada y a su vez esto le contribuir  a mejorar  su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 and lives in her own home with her non-dependent children. Because they work she is a single mother who strives to help her family get ahead. For many years she has made her living selling tortillas, cosmetics, sodas and purified water. Dona Maria's customers are her neighbors and friends who stop by daily to buy her tortillas. They prefer the good service they receive from her. Her house is located in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras. 

Dona Maria is requesting this loan to buy cement, sand, bars, sheet metal and construction materials to improve the roof, hallway and bathrooms in her home. With this loan she hopes to fulfill one of her dreams which is to have her home remodeled and, as a result, improve her quality of life. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May, 2015

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bars and sheet metal for her house.

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi is a 35-year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee. Due to the limited work access of Palestinians in Lebanon, he decided four years ago to open his car repair shop in an attempt to increase his income and satisfy the needs and expenses of his family.

Chadi is trying hard to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary car repair tools to facilitate his business and provide his customers with better service. 

Chadi hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools to facilitate his car repair business

loans.name: Kelly

texts.en:
Kelly is a single man. He operates a retail business where he sells phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a productive market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of phone accessories. This will enable him increase sales and profits.His business goal is to he will have a stable business within 5 years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of phone accessories

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Karine hopes her request for second deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon will again be successful as her first one. Karine has two daughters and a son. Her daughters are married already. She still manages her trading business at the city wholesale market. Simultaneously in a nearby village Tandziver Karine runs farming and agriculture. She has rabbits, chickens, a pig and also several bee families. 

With the help of her husband and son Karine takes care of her farm and also orchard, where she has persimmon, apple, apricot, nuts and plum trees. She sells her orchard harvest to re-seller and some part of it she also uses for her family. This Kiva loan she asks as the irrigation pipes of her orchard needs to be repaired and this loan amount will be great help for her.

loans.use: for the repairing an irrigation pipes for her orchard

loans.name: Hantone

texts.en:
Hantone is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be competent. He operates a food stall. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. His business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Here is Adelina. She didn't complete her studies. She only attained high school and though she wants to continue this, her age seems not to fit anymore. She is 55 years old living at Parañaque City, Philippines and is married to Rodrigo. They have four kids by now, and the other one now is working. To support her children, she busies herself in managing her small sari-sari store, (a variety store in common) where she gains a not-so-high profit. 

Adelina wants you to know that she wants to expand her business. But she doesn't have enough capital. She wants to provide stocks of grocery items for her store in large quantities that's why she would like to ask for a PHP 30,000 loan from you. Hoping a lot that you'd consider, Adelina plans to earn savings from the profit she will gain from the expansion. 

Her three kids have already finished their studies and only one is left. She also dreams to see him graduate and become a professional worker someday. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to provide stocks of grocery items for her store in large quantities

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 35, married and has 2 little daughters. He has a feed sales project and he previously requested a 4000 EGP loan form TADE and successfully repaid it on due dates. He is requesting another 4000 EGP to buy different kinds of feed such as yellow corn and lentil.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of feed such as yellow corn and lentil.

loans.name: Lyonik

texts.en:
Lyonik is 36 years old and he lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region. He lives with his wife, two sons and his parents. Lyonik is a framer and he is specialized in pig breeding and agriculture. In his farm he has a lot of pigs and piglets and also chickens.  He sells great amount of pork and also eggs to his numerous regular customers all over the region. 

Lyonik also has rich orchard and he manages to sell harvest of persimmon, apple, apricot, peach, plum and nuts. These all he sells at the wholesale market during the week. Since farming is the only source of income for his big family he wants to develop especially pig breeding in his farm. With the Kiva loan Lyonik wants to buy piglets and also enough fodder for all the pigs in his farm.

loans.use: to buy piglets and also enough fodder for all the pigs in his farm

loans.name: Yosinta

texts.en:
Yosinta is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 5 years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which deals in essential goods. 

To help expand her business, Yosinta has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase for more essential goods to attract customers, and will help her to generate greater profits and increase on her family income. She hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger supermarket in town. 

Yosinta is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more essential goods to attract customers,

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Maria has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which deals in essential goods. 

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 4000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to invest essential goods to attract more customers, and will help Maria to generate greater profits and improving on her livelihood. Maria hopes that in the future she will be able to open up other branches in different towns. 

Maria is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Maria who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to invest essential goods to attract more customers

loans.name: Muye

texts.en:
Muye is a married man. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are regular. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy stock of sugar, flour and other household items for sell in the shop he opened for his wife. His business goal is to have a bigger business with many motorcycles within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stock of sugar, flour and other household items for sell

loans.name: Howeida

texts.en:
Howeida is a 51 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children attending school. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time, as per her husband, he is the main income provider in the family, he owns a minimarket and also works as a driver to help his beloved family to live in good circumstances. 

Today, given that her children will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the school fees. The parents’ only wish is to provide their children with a respectable educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her three children

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a profitable business within 5 years.

loans.use: buy tea farm inputs

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 56 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is widow and has 4 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Veronica has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells plastic shoes. 

To help expand her business, Veronica has requested a loan of 5000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock enough shoes that will be sold to students going back to school, and will help Veronica to generate greater profits and pay her kids school needs on time. Veronica hopes that in the future she will be able to start building rental houses in her remaining plot of land. 

Veronica is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Veronica who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock enough shoes that will be sold to students going back to school,

loans.name: Odel

texts.en:
Buy-and-sell enterprise is simply understood as buying of products in low price and selling the same products in higher price. The difference between the two costs will be the entrepreneur’s profit. The products may range from cheap rags to expensive condominiums or house and lot, depending on the entrepreneur’s capital. 

Odel, 48, is doing buy-and-sell of various products such as cellphones, kitchen wares and cooking sets, electric fans, and other appliances. He has contact manufacturers and dealers from whom he can get the products in lower prices. He will then sell the products directly to his friends, neighbors, relatives and other network. To his advantage, he chooses the products that do not decay or rot. But the disadvantage is, his chosen products are expensive thus it requires a higher capital. Now that he plans to buy more items for sale, he would like to borrow supplementary capital amounting to PhP 50,000. He will add items like dining tables, chairs and flat screen TV's. He already has target buyers for these, so hopefully his request will be granted soon.

Odel is married to Flora and they are living in Caloocan City. He dreams of a comfortable life someday so he can extend blessings to deprived people. He is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and he regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy items for sale like dining tables, chairs, and flat screen TV's

loans.name: Azildo

texts.pt:
Senhor Azildo tem 38 anos de idade, casado, pai de 2 filhas frequentando o ensino secundário, trabalha como técnico de tecto falsos e divisórias, e também é negociante, vive em casa própria com a sua família a qual ele sustenta.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de arroz, açúcar, leite, farinha, óleo, massas, amendoim, batata, cebola, alho, para revender na sua mercearia e consequentemente aliviar a grande procura que havia por parte dos clientes.
Nos próximos tempos pretende construir mais uma mercearia visto que vive numa zona em expansão e as pessoas percorrem longas distâncias para encontrar uma mercearia.
O grande desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar mora de modo a garantir futuros empréstimos.
texts.en:
Azildo is 38 years old, married and the father of two daughters who go to secondary school. He works as a fitter of false ceilings and dividing walls and is also a businessman. He lives in his own home with his family who he supports financially. 

This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, milk, flour, oil, pasta, peanuts, potatoes, onions, and garlic to resell in his grocery store and as a result meet the demand from his customers.  

In the short term future Azildo would like to build another grocery store since he lives in an area which is expanding and people travel long distances to come to his store.

His main challenge is to pay off his loan without delays so as to guarantee future loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, flour, oil, pasta, peanuts, potatoes, onions, and garlic to resell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 34 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Stella has been working hard to manage her hard ware business, which transacts building materials. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more of iron sheets,cement and other building materials to trade, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and take care of her family and providing all the basic needs in time. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to owning a plot of land and build rental houses. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more of iron sheets,cement and other building materials to trade,

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kasaganti in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, she has been working hard to manage her beauty salon business, which deals in hair braiding. 

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of 4000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock all types of hair relaxers and braids for her salon, and will help EDITH to generate greater profits and increase on her family income. She hopes that in the future she will be able to improve more on her profits so as to have the best salon in town. 

Edith is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock all types of hair relaxers and braids for her salon,

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 33 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is Married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Monica has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which vends men and ladies cloths. 

To help expand her business, Monica has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to invest more in men shirts and ladies clothes to increase on her sales, and will help Monica to generate greater profits and managed to buy some building materials to complete her commercial house. Monica hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a whole sale shop. 

Monica is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Monica who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to invest more in men shirts and ladies clothes to increase on her sales

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which vends essential house hold goods. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sacks of maize flour to be sold out to schools, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and providing enough basic needs for her kids in time. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to producing quality products. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more sacks of maize flour to be sold out to schools,

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Shamim has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which deals in essential goods. 

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock enough essential items for the store to attract her customers and will help Shamim to generate greater profits and paying her kids school needs on time. Shamim hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business and add other more item that are most needed. 

Shamim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shamim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock enough essential items for the store to attract her customers,

loans.name: Shahen

texts.en:
Shahen is 49 years old and he lives in frontier village Achajur of Tavush region. He is a farmer who covers all his family needs only through his farm’s income. He has cows, a bull, pigs and chickens in his farm. He also has wine yard and nice orchard full of apple, apricot, peach and plum trees. 

All his farm products Shahen with the help of his wife sells at the wholesale market of their city. Shahen especially has success and good profit from meat selling and in order to have it further he must develop it. This loan he will use for the purchase of pigs and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of pigs and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Haylana Group

texts.en:
Haylana is the featured borrower for Haylana Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Haylana is a 32-year-old married mother of three children who prepares and sells "Mouneh" from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is an ambitious woman and sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions. 

Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business of selling clothes as a second source of income. Haylana is the first lady on the right, Amena is the lady sitting in the middle and Fatima is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling clothes as a second source of income

loans.name: Helder

texts.pt:
Senhor Hélder tem 43 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de 5 filhos frequentando o ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, é motorista e vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O valor financiado será aplicado para comprar cimento, areia, pedra, varões para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa visto que é pequena para albergar a família toda.
No futuro pretende construir uma mercearia visto que a esposa é negociante e vende ao relento.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros empréstimos.
texts.en:
Hélder is 43 years old, lives with his wife and is the father of five children who go to primary and high school respectively. He is a driver and lives in his own home with his family. 

Hélder's loan will be used to buy cement, sand, stones and rods to continue building his home since it is quite small to house all his family.

In the future Hélder hopes to build a grocery store as his wife is a businesswoman and sells goods as a street vendor. His main challenge is to pay off his loan without delay so he can guarantee future loans.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stones and rods to continue building

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her Cosmetic store, which deals in cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 4000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to possess more types of body lotions and other beauty cosmetics and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and being able to pay for her medical bills. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger plot of land so as to build her residential house and rentals. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fatuma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to possess more types of body lotions and other beauty cosmetics

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which trades first hand cloths. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 5000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase for more fashionable clothes to increase on her profits, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increasing her capital. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand of her business that will give her enough space to do her work well. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more fashionable clothes to increase on her profits,

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 45 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children. For the past , she has been working hard to manage her bar business, which owns a bar that trends soft drinks and spirits. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 4000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more soft drinks and spirits to increase on her sales, and will help LYDIA to generate greater profits and having a good health life with his family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to own another business of the same kind in different towns. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lidia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add more soft drinks and spirits to increase on her sales,

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. She has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 21 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her beauty salon business, which deals in hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more hair braids in her salon to attract her customers and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increasing on her monthly profits hence having a good life. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to growing the business into a learning center to train hair dressing hence reducing on the employment level that is too high in there community. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add more hair braids in her salon to attract her customers,

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 45 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Amor works very hard to provide for them.

Amor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Amor has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Amor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a single man with his children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop of general merchandise. He also does farming and owns a motorcycle, where he gets additional income. He started the business in order to cater to his parents and to earn a living. 

He used the previous loan to buy land for himself and now he intends to construct his house with the loan he is requesting for. Richard is a hard-working man, faced with challenges of limited capital and bad weather.

Richard will use the loan facility to buy construction materials like blocks,cement and others to build his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like blocks,cement and others to build his house.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is 31 years old, married to a house wife, and has 2 children. He takes care of his aging father who lives with him in the same house. He previously, requested a Kiva loan for a small a café and successfully repaid it. 

Assad has a small fattening project and is requesting a 12,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his milk sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle to increase milk sales

loans.name: Shakilah

texts.en:
Shakillah is 29 years old and lives in the town of Fortpotal in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Shakillah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which vends essential house hold goods. 

To help expand her business, Shakillah has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to acquire for more essential goods to attract her customers, and will help Shakillah to generate greater profits and increase on her family income. Shakillah hopes that in the future she will be able to having enough stock for the business. 

Shakillah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shakillah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to acquire for more essential goods to attract her customers,

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a single mother of one child, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity  nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital in her business.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rosebud

texts.en:
Rosebud is 33 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 9 years, Rosebud has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which deals in house hold goods. 

To help expand her business, Rosebud has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more stock of other more essentials to be sold in her store and will help Rosebud to generate greater profits and improving on her stock by adding other more different items in the store to attract her customers. Rosebud hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business to another level of owning a whole sale shop. 

Rosebud is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rosebud who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add more stock of other more essentials to be sold in her store,

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 32 years old man from Kakamega region, he is married and support three people in his family together with his wife.

He operates a motorbike transport, a business he has been doing for the last four years and generates a monthly income of KES. 19,000, he has applied for her first loan with Visionfund Kenya which he will use to purchase a new motorbike, he will use the anticipated profit to maintain his business and support his family.

His dream is to have a stable business so as to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase new motorbike to help him raise more income to support his famili

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity  nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs of 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: sell bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity  nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 13 years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and lack of capital in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 13 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital in her place of operation.In addition she runs a business of renting houses which earns her source of income.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a married woman with one kid, who is still young to attend school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Subira  has operated a grocery vegetables selling stall for the past two years, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 


With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Oro Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Oro es un grupo mixto, conformado por 2 mujeres y un varón (Jodie Kendra, Magdalena y Hartilio) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son emprendedores que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de productos básicos; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente año y medio para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana.

Jodie Kendra: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora sonriente y cordial de 29 años de edad, con cualidades líder y deseos de superación. Está casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 7 años estudia su segundo grado de primaria y una pequeña de 2 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como albañil. Desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Recuerda con gran alegría que inicio vendiendo chiverías y accesorios para damas de acero. Gracias a las ganancias percibidas y a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido adquirir su propio tramo y establecer una pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chivería, sopas instantáneas, pan, huevo, y calzados en Masaya. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The supportive group Oro is a mixed group, made up of 2 women and a man (Jodie Kendra, Magdalena, and Hartilio) of the ethnic group miskita in the city of Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are entrepreneurs who work day to day, making the effort to achieve growth for their small businesses of basic products. They organized as a supportive group almost one year and a half ago, to be able to obtain a loan from Pana Pana.
