Jodie Kendra: she is the coordinator of the group, she is a smiling and cordial woman who is 29 years old, with leadership qualities and dreams of improvement. She is married with 2 children, the older one is 7 years old and studies in second grade, and a young girl who is 2 years old. Her husband works informally as a construction worker. Three years ago, she opened a small grocery shop. In this way she contributes to her household expenses and her children’s schooling. She remembers with great happiness that she started selling dairy products and steel accessories for ladies. Thanks to the profits and the previously obtained loans by PANA PANA and financed by Kiva, it has allowed her to acquire her own space and establish a small store. She is asking for financing to purchase staple grains, dairy products, instant soups, bread, eggs, and footwear in Masaya. Her dream is to have a prosperous business, and improve the conditions of her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, dairy products, instant soups, and footwear.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 53 years old married man, from Kaspi district. He has son and wife, who lives abroad and works there. Giorgi and his son earn a living with small agricultural activity. They are engaged in pig and chicken breeding. The family gets really small income from this business and finds it hard to meet all daily costs. 
There is high unemployment rate in the region, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.  

So, Giorgi decided to start his own stable activity and purchase a car. According to above mentioned situation, he lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Giorgi to get a loan of 2500 USD and start providing taxi service.
 
Giorgi will serve local people as a taxi driver and will get his own source of income. The new business initiative will give Giorgi the chance to have financial stability and monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase a car and become a taxi driver

loans.name: Ravinh

texts.en:
Ravinh is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bundibunyo in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is Mmarried and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 8 years, she has been working hard to manage her cloth and shoe business, which deals in clothes. 

To help expand her business, shehas requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase for more clothes and plastic shoes for trending, and will help Ravinhto generate greater profits and improving her business into a whole sale shop. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business and own a bigger store to employ more workers. 

Ravinh is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more clothes and plastic shoes for trending

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 20 years old she lives at her parents house.  She sell used clothes and has a stand at one well known place.  Laura is also selling cosmetics.

 Laura needs a loan to buy more clothes for her business.  She works hard and has experience and she is single and without children.  She will save all the money she can get and hopes you can help her, because her parents are not working right now.  In the picture you can see her with part of her merchandise

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is Widow and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which sales garment clothes and craft items in her store. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase for more clothes to sell and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and paying school fees for her two kids. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to build rentals of her own. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more clothes to sell,

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 61-year-old married woman. She started thirty two years ago, working with cattle. She gained experience in this domain, from her parents, and later on from her husband. She started her business with one cow and now she has six. She sells delicious milk and dairy to cover the needs and expenses of her family. She is well known among her region and has her loyal customers. 

Khadija is always working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new cow which will help her increase her production. 
Khadija hopes to expand her business more in the future through buying necessary milk machines which will facilitate her work and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new cow which will help her increase her milk production

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a widowed mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 15 years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is a married woman who has no children . She lives at her own  house that has no piped water but has electricity. She cites food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past five years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating of hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 27, married to a housewife and has one child. He takes care of his aging parents. He works in a blacksmith work shop and he wanted to partner with the owner so he requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy new blacksmith tools such as profane forage and hammers to save time and effort and increase his income

loans.use: To buy new blacksmith tools such as profane forage and hammers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her poultry business

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 3500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to procure for more chickens to increase on her stock for dealing them out, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and managed to add more chickens that increased on her stock and improved on her sales. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to have more eggs that will be enough to be supplied. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to procure for more chickens to increase on her stock for selling them,

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her poultry business. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 4000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chickens for sale hence increase on her capital, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and hope to have enough chicken birds that will call for more customers. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to improving her business more and open up another branch of poultry chicken. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for sale hence increase on her capital,

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is 47 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has 5 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Kasifa has been working hard to manage her glass business, which owns a business that sales glass. 

To help expand her business, Kasifa has requested a loan of 4500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase for more glass for sale hence increasing her profits, and will help Kasifa to generate greater profits and helping her family benefit from the business like paying their medical bills. Kasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to increase more on her profits. 

Kasifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kasifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more glass for sale hence increasing her profits,

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena is a 33-year-old married mother of two children. Fourteen years ago, she started working as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a good reputation among her region for her professional skills. 
Amena is working hard and trying desperately to develop her business and improve her living conditions. Today, She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary beauty tools to satisfy her customers' needs, and to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for her family. 

Amena hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better life.

loans.use: to buy necessary beauty supplies and tools and also to renovate her house

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edwina is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Edwina has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Edwina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Edwina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Edwina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her manicure business

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married woman with five children. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Veronicah has operated a tailoring business for the past 15 years. She makes suits for women and men. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a widowed woman with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasiti operates a fruit and vegetables selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Isla Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Isla, es un grupo solidario mixto, conformado por 2 mujeres y un varon emprendedor (Prudencia, Erika Roxana y Jose Roberto), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 12 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

José Roberto: Es un de joven 23 años de edad, coordinador del grupo solidario, con deseos de superación y cualidades de lider, casado. Su esposa es comerciante. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal desde hace 5 años vende en su tramo en uno de los mercados de Bilwi ropa nueva, con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Solicita su tercer financiamiento para comprar en Managua: carteras, billeteras, entre otros productos, venderlos a precios favorable a su clientela de Bilwi y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es diversificar sus productos. Con los 2 créditos anteriores otorgados por Pana Pana y financiados por KIVA, les permitió a los 3 integrantes del grupo solidario incrementar el inventario de sus productos
texts.en:
The supportive group Isla is a mixed group, made up of two women and one man (Prudencia, Erika Roxana, and Jose Roberto). They live in the city of Bilwi and they got together 12 months ago with the purpose of working in a supportive way to be able to have access to loans in Pana Pana, which will allow them to increase the inventory in their small business, increase their income, and so little by little improve the conditions of life of their families. 

Jose Roberto: he is a young man who is 23 years old, coordinator of the supportive group, with dreams of improvement and leadership qualities, and married. His wife works in retail. Due to the lack of formal employment, for the last 5 years he has sold new clothing in his section in one of the markets of Bilwi, with the goal of having his source of income and contribute to household expenses. He is asking for his third financing to buy in Managua: purses, wallets, among other products, and sell them at a good price to his clients in Bilwi and in this way improve his income. His dream is to diversify his products. The two previous loans given by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, allowed the three members of the supportive group to increase their product inventory.

loans.use: to buy wallets and purses, among other products.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental  house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize flour, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jesita

texts.en:
Jesita is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of maize flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize flour, beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Grace To Grace Group

texts.en:
Janet is 40 years of age. She is from Mankessim in the Mfantsiman District of the Central Region of Ghana. Janet is a member of Grace to Grace Group. She is married with 1 child of 27 years.

Janet is a food vendor who sells local dishes to several customers within her local community. She has 10 years working experience. Janet has two employees. She wants to expand her business in the next 5 years to be able to provide better services to her customers. Janet's vision therefore is to transform her "chop" food bar into a restaurant of class in the coming years.

Janet has been financing her business with a micro loan from the field partner since 2009 and this is her 10th loan cycle. She had excellent loan repayments records with her past 9 loan cycles. Janet needs additional working capital to buy cassava, fish, meat and other cooking ingredients for the preparation of food for her food bar so as to serve her customers on time.

The additional micro loan will help Janet to increase her sales and income to reinvest into her business and make some savings to support her husband to cater for her family. Janet thanks all her micro lenders for their kindness in helping her to realise her dreams.

loans.use: to buy cassava, fish, meat and cooking ingredients for preparation of food at the restaurant

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has ten school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mariam operates a business of renting houses to the community. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to establish other rental houses, to purchase cements and sand for construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cements and sand for construction.

loans.name: Salvador Emilio

texts.es:
Salvador es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, desde hace más de 20 años inició su negocio de ferretería y venta de accesorios, para mejorar la mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Él siempre se ha dedicado a las ventas porque sus padres también se lo hacían. Y gracias a los financiamientos de mi crédito ha podido ampliar su local. 

Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para comprar artículos electrónicos y ferreteros como baterías, carcasas, llaves, martillos, clavos, tornillos etc. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer variedad de productos, en consiguiente, incrementará sus ingresos.  Salvador también planea ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Salvador is a hard-working and entrepreneurial man. Over 20 years ago, he opened his hardware business and accessory sales, to improve the quality of life of his family. He has always worked in sales because his parents also did it. And thanks for the financing of his credit, he has been able to expand his store. 

He is asking for a loan to buy electronic and hardware items, such as batteries, casings, keys, hammers, nails, screws, etc. This will be helpful because he will offer a variety of products, therefore increasing his profits. Salvador also plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy hardware and electronic items, such as batteries, casings, keys, hammers, nails, screws, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Iniciar un negocio no es fácil, requiere de tiempo y dedicación, Rosario es testigo de esto pues ella hace un par de años inició con la venta de ropa en su casa que con el tiempo se dio a conocer y ganó muchos clientes. Hoy tiene un negocio próspero y rentable, gracias al apoyo de MiCrédito que le ha realizado préstamos para invertir en su negocio.

Sin embargo, solicita un financiamiento para la compra de camisas, pantalones, zapatos, perfumes, ropa interior, etc. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer nuevos estilos de ropa y así incrementarán sus ingresos. Con las ganancias, planea mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
To start a business is not easy, it requires time and dedication. Rosario is a witness of this, as two years ago she began selling clothes in her home. With time, she became known and gained many clients. Today, she has a prosperous and profitable business, thanks to the support of MiCredito, which has given loans to invest in her business. 
However, she is asking for financing for the purchase of shirts, pants, shoes, perfumes, underwear, etc. This will be helpful because she will be able to offer new clothing styles and therefore increase her income. With the profits, she plans to improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shoes, perfumes, and underwear.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with one child who does not attend school. She lives at her own house, which has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past two years, selling goat meat to the neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 29 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. 

For the past four years, Jane has been working hard to manage her restaurant business, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of Irish potatoes, charcoal and more chicken to sell at her small restaurant, and it will help Jane to generate greater profits and employ more workers, since her business has expanded. 

Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to have a well known restaurant in town providing the best services. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of Irish potatoes, charcoal and more chicken to sell at her small restaurant.

loans.name: Argelia Esperanza

texts.es: Argelia de 55 años de edad es viuda y una mujer trabajadora que vive junto a su hija de 27 años de edad quien bebido a la lamentable pérdida su padre tuvo que abandonar sus estudios universitarios para dedicarse a trabajar y de esta manera ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Argelia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo y además es modista, gracias a su labor ha podido sacar adelante a su hija y suplir las necesidades del hogar. Argelia desea instalar un nuevo servicio sanitario en su vivienda, ya que con el que cuenta actualmente es de fosa seca y presenta una fuga de malos olores que está ocasionando enfermedades a su familia y vecinos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en los gastos de instalación de tuberías  para aguas negras  y luego construir el servicio sanitario lavable para mantener la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en: Argelia is 55 years old. She is a widow and a hardworking woman. She lives with her 27 year old daughter who unfortunately had to leave college for work when she lost her father. In this way, she helps her mother with the household expenses. Argelia sells beauty products via catalog. She is also a seamstress. Thanks to her work, she has been able to get her daughter ahead and meet the household needs. Argelia wants to install a new plumbing system in her home in her home. The one she has now is a dry toilet system and it causes bad odors that are causing illness for the family and for neighbors. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in installing sewage pipes and later build a bathroom to maintain sanitation in her home.

loans.use: to invest in paying for the installation of sewage pipes and then build a bathroom to maintain sanitation in her home.

loans.name: Princesa Pacha

texts.es: Princesa tiene 23 años de edad es soltera tiene 2 hijos vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Pucarapamba es madre soltera ella se dedica a la agricultura, solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca para producción de leche y hacer quesos asi tener otra fuente de ingreso y sustentar a sus hijos, su sueño es vivir en mejores condiciones de vida , el desafio al que se enfrenta es el clima y en su tiempo libre le gusta tejer.
texts.en: Princesa is 23 years old. She is single and has 2 children. She lives in Guaranda in the Bolivar province in the Pucarapamba community. She is a single mother and she works in agriculture. She is asking for the loan to buy a cow for milk production and to make cheese. This way, she will have another source of income to support her children. Her dream is to have a better standard of living. The challenge she faces is weather, and in her free time she likes to knit.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fertilzer to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero is a married woman who has five children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business that is her source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and neighbours. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feeds and chicks for resale.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a widowed mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bisha

texts.en:
Bisha is a married woman. She has one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

For the past seven years, she has owned a food stall business. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding the business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es: Atilio de 64 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se dedica desde hace más de veinticinco años como motorista del transporte público  lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Atilio vive en casa  de su propiedad desde hace varios años junto a su nieto de 6 años y su hija de 27 años de edad quien es madre soltera y se dedica a impartir clase en una escuela cercana como profesora. Atilio desde hace algún tiempo desea construir un servicio sanitario en su vivienda el cual sea lavable ya que actualmente posee uno que no brinda mucha higiene a su hogar debido a que es de fosa seca por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en un proyecto comunitario que consiste en la instalación de tuberías de aguas negras y de esta manera posteriormente construir un servicio sanitario lavable de su vivienda que brinde una mayor sanidad a su familia.
texts.en: Atilio is 64 years old. He is a hardworking man who has been a public transportation driver for more than twenty-five years. This allows him to get his family ahead. Atilio lives in a house he has owned for several years with his 6 year old grandson and his 27 year old daughter, who works at a nearby school as a teacher. For some time, Atilio has wanted to build a bathroom in his home with indoor plumbing, since the one he has now doesn't offer much sanitation because it is a dry toilet system. That is why he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in a community project which is the installation of sewage pipes. Then he will build a bathroom in his house so his family will have better sanitation.

loans.use: to invest in a community project that consists of sewage pipe installation and later build a bathroom.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijas, las tres viven con ella y estudian, su hermana también vive con ella, pero solo sus hijas dependen de ella.

Reina, tiene una panadería desde hace 6 años, aprendió este trabajo practicando con pequeñas cantidades, no tiene otras actividades económicas antes solo estudiaba y ayudaba en la casa donde vive, su hermana le ayuda en el negocio y comienza a trabajar desde las 5:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m.

Reina, necesita el préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar y todos los insumos para elaborar pan, el préstamo mejorara su condición económica.

Reina, sueña con tener un horno más y espera que sus hijas se preparen academicament
texts.en:
Reina, who is 35 years old, studied until 9th grade. She is a single mother and has three daughters who live with her and go to school. Her sister also lives with her, but only her daughters depend on her. 

Reina has had a bakery for the last 6 years. She learned this occupation practicing in small quantities. She does not have any other occupation, before she only studied and helped in the house where she lives. Her sister helps in the business, and starts work from 5:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.

Reina needs the loan to buy flour, sugar, and all the supplies to make bread. The loan will improve her economic situation.

Reina dreams of having another oven and hopes that her daughters prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and all the supplies to make bread.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a widowed woman with eight children, none of whom attend school. For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop where she sells household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Umazi’s major business challenge is seasonality. She lives in her own house without electricity or running water. Umazi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Umazi is requesting a loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Gamal

texts.en:
Gamal is 27, married to a housewife and has 2 children. He takes care of his aging mother .

He has a small fattening project and he previously requested 10,000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates. He is requesting a 15,000 EGP loan to buy more cattle to generate more income for his family through milk and calves sales.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for increased milk and calf sales

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with  six children, three of  whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Amina operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dress making. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her motorcycle transport business.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlinda is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Merlinda has a making and selling ice cream business in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 45 years old, a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Nelia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Norma Judith

texts.es:
Norma, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, se caso pero hace 6 años está separada, tiene dos hijos de su matrimonio y están estudiando.

Norma, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace más 4 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de su familia pero especialmente de su madre.- Norma, además de la venta de ropa, tiene un empleo temporal de donde obtiene otros ingresos.

Norma, necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa como camisas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior, etc. Con esto lograra tener más productos para vender..
   
Los sueños de Norma, es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y ver crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma, who is 40 years old, studied until 7th grade. She married, but then separated 6 years ago. She has two sons from that marriage who are in school. 
Norma has worked in the sale of clothing for more than 4 years. She learned this work from her family, especially from her mother. Besides the clothing sales, she has a temporary job from which she obtains more income. 
She needs the loan to buy more clothing, such as shirts, pants, skirts, underwear, etc. This way she will manage to have more products to sell.
Her dreams are to see her children finish their studies and see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, such as shirts, pants, skirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, bath soap detergent, seasoning and shampoo

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlyn is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a food processing business in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merlyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with four children of whom three go to school. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda where she is a market vendor and sells fresh foods which include tomatoes, cabbages and onions. She also gets additional income from her cocoa garden, where she sells cocoa to cocoa traders which she has done for four years now. 

She is a very hard working lady who has plans of expanding her business, but she lacks enough capital to invest. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy fresh food stuffs like tomatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fresh food stuffs like tomatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evadesi

texts.en:
Evadesi a 48-year-old mother of 4 children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For 10 years, Evadesi has operated a retail shop which is gradually growing and also has a cocoa garden where she gets additional income by selling cocoa to cocoa traders. 

She is a determined lady and has plans of expanding her business into a wholesale shop. She faces a challenge of limited capital to buy enough stock for trading. 

Evadesi is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like soap, sugar, tea leaves and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soap, sugar, tea leaves and salt to sell.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a married woman with five children, one of whom attends school. For the past three years, she had operated a shop where she sells household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Chari’s major business challenge is transportation. She lives in her own house without electricity or running water. Chari decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Chari is requesting a loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling to cocoa companies.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina de 51 años de edad  vive con su nieto, tiene casa propia en la ciudad de Nacaome Valle,  se dedica desde hace muchos años a su negocio que es un Molino y también a la venta de ropa nueva y plásticos.
Doña Marcelina sus clientes son vecinos, amigos y  todas las personas de la colonia que desde muy de mañana la visitan para quebrar su maíz y elaborar las ricas y deliciosas tortillas, también vende su producto como ser ropa, sandalias y plástico en los diferentes comunidades, es una mujer  muy trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante y agradece a  Prisma, ya que poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio y su vivienda.
Doña Marcelina esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de repuestos para su molino  y compra de blusas, pantalones y camisas, etc. para surtir un poco sus negocios y mejorar sus ventas, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su familia.
Uno de sus sueños es que en el próximo préstamo sea para mejorar  su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2015
texts.en:
Marcelina, who is 51 years old, lives with her grandson. She has her own house in the city of Nacaome Valle. She has worked for many years in her business, which is a mill, and also the sale of new clothing and plastics. 
Marcelina’s clients are her neighbors, friends, and all the people in the neighborhood, who from the early morning visit her to grind their corn and make the delicious tortillas. She also sells her products of clothes, sandals, and plastics in the different communities. She is a hard-working woman with many dreams to get ahead, and she is thankful to Prisma, as little by little she has been improving her business and her house. 
Marcelina is asking for a loan to purchase replacements for her mill and purchase of blouses, pants, and shirts, etc. to supply her businesses and improve her sales. She hopes this investment will allow her to get ahead with her family. 
One of her dreams is that the next loan will be to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – May 2015.

loans.use: to purchase replacements for her mill, and blouses, pants, and shirts for her businesses.

loans.name: Shereefa

texts.en:
Shereefa is 44 and is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. She has four children. Shereefa runs a small grocery stall where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has successfully repaid two prior loans.

Shereefa is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy fruits and vegetables such as mangoes, apples, zucchini, and tomatoes. Her loan will help generate more income for her family. Shereefa plans to help her husband buy a house on installment, as their current house is about to fall.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, apples, zucchini, and tomatoes

loans.name: Nokwandisa

texts.en:
Nokwandisa is a 43-year old married mother of 2 boys and 2 girls. Her husband is currently unemployed, leaving her as the sole breadwinner. She has been running a day care center for the last four years, from the back of her house, to sustain her family.  

The day care has steadily grown and now needs more room to accommodate the children. She is therefore requesting a loan to construct a classroom. 

With the Kiva loan, she will buy cement, bricks, timber and window frames as well as to pay contractors to build the room.

She is hardworking and relentless; "This loan will change my life and my family's life."

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, timber and window frames

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is 38 years old and is from the Samtredia district. He lives with his pensioner mother, school-aged daughter, and his wife, who works as a sick-nurse and gets a small salary. Malkhaz has been unable to start any stable job. He works as a small-scale farmer and harvests nuts and sells them locally during their season. Malkhaz’s family has poor living conditions because their income is insufficient to cover all their daily costs. Malkhaz has sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts have been unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

Malkhaz is requesting a 2,000 USD loan to purchase a second-hand car and start a taxi business. His loan application has been approved under the framework of a startup program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This program enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Malkhaz will use his loan to serve local people and earn a daily income. His loan will greatly assist him to improve his economic situation and give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie, 51, is a vendor (of fruits and vegetables) by trade. For eight years now, her two children witnessed how she endured everything just to find a way to support Bienvinido (her husband) in generating enough income to provide for the family. 

Marjorie didn't finish her studies. Though it was actually a disappointment, she never considers herself a mess. In contrast, she strives even more to prove that success is never far from reach to those who have the guts to take risks and courage to face life. 

She is very enthusiastic and positive in life. In fact, she is very hopeful today that you would allow her to borrow the amount she needed (PHP 50,000 in particular) to garner additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall at the marketplace. Maybe this is also the reason why her colleagues enjoy her company. 

To mention they regularly meet every week to encourage one another (simultaneously studying the word of God).  She has this living hope. She believes that someday, through hard work, her inventory will grow and that her family's condition will stay safe, successful and sound.  

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to garner additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall at the marketplace.

loans.name: Cornet

texts.en:
Cornet is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy fertilizer. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu highly appreciates your kind generosity, dear lenders. Your previous loan worth PhP 22,000 enabled her to buy more grocery items that resulted to a higher income for her family. It was a big help in their daily needs and child’s education. Thank you so much!

She was able to pay her previous loan faithfully. To continue improving her business, she is asking for PhP 25,000 loan this time. Again, she will use this to buy additional supplies and products for her inventory. She has a good integrity to maintain her capacity to repay.

Marichu continuously meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and products for her variety store

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She operates a stall where she sells vegetables and groceries to town-dwellers and neighbors. Mwanasha’s greatest business challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of business. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. Mwanasha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mwanasha is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Komang

texts.en:
Komang is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in sterling silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including silver, gemstones and pearls for his designs.

Komang has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I've wanted to create silver jewelry since I was in elementary school. By the time I was in junior high, I was crafting my own pieces, thanks to a friend's parents who are silversmiths. When I finished high school, I set up my own workshop and started crafting jewelry there. Creating new designs is very exciting."

"I need capital to buy silver and gemstones to craft more units of my jewelry. Your support is highly appreciated, and I hope you will like the pieces I will create."

Use the link below to view Komang's sterling silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7744

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including silver, gemstones and pearls for his designs

loans.name: Las Llovisnas Group

texts.en:
Ciénaga Grande is located on the Panamerican Highway approximately three hours from Guatemala City. Seven women have united here to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Llovisnas”. The ladies share that their small businesses are not only successful but have grown. They are pleased to be requesting their second loan from Friendship Bridge they hope will be funded by Kiva investors.

Estrella is 21 years old and a member of the Trust Bank. She has been elected Treasurer. Although she is the youngest member of the group, she was able to finish her secondary studies. Estrella was unable to secure employment and so she started her own business of making traditional blouses in various colors called “quichelenses” that she sells in various parts of the country.  (The woman in the above photo are wearing a “quichelense”) 

Estrella is requesting a loan to purchase lace, pearls, fabric and other supplies for her pretty blouses. Her clients really like her designs and many are repeat customers.

Although the majority of the ladies in the Trust Bank were unable to complete their elementary school studies, they are very aware of the value of education. Each month at their meetings, the women are eager to learn about various everyday topics from a Friendship Bridge Loan Facilitator who communicates with them in their own indigenous language using diagrams, pictures and role playing. Some of the topics covered include healthy habits (nutrition, hygiene), self-esteem (empowerment, women’s rights) and effective business practices. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

Estrella speaks on behalf of herself and her friends in the Trust Bank in thanking Kiva investors for their generosity in funding their much-needed loans. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase needles, thread, lace and other necessities to fabricate beautiful, traditional blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his retail business with merchandise that he will resell.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 40 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 12, 18 y 19 años de edad, además   vive con ellos su madre de 67 años de edad. Sonia se caracteriza por ser una madre e hija muy trabajadora y responsable que quiere  dar un futuro mejor a su familia, por ello en la semana se dedica a atender un chalet en el centro escolar de la zona  desde hace 4 años, en el cual vende diferentes golosinas, y es así como ella gana la vida y logra brindar lo mejor a su familia, además su compañero de vida le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Sonia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder construir un cuarto al lado de casa con el propósito de que sus hijos se desarrollen en un hogar más amplio, para ello invertirá en: hierro, ladrillos, cemento, grava y arena para construir un cuarto en su propiedad.
texts.en:
Sonia is 40 years old and lives very happily with her life partner and their three children, ages 12, 18, and 19. Her mother, 67 years old, also lives with them. Sonia is a very hardworking and responsible mother and daughter, and she wants to provide a better future for her family. Because of this, she has worked for the past four years selling sweets in a building near the local school, and in this way she earns a living and gives the best for her family. In addition, her partner helps out with household expenses. 

Sonia requests a loan from FUSAI so that she can build a room next to her house so that her children can have more room to grow; to accomplish this, she will invest in iron, bricks, cement, gravel, and sand to build a room on her property.

loans.use: to invest in iron, bricks, cement, gravel, and sand to build a room on her property.

loans.name: Suyapa Marina

texts.es:
La señora  Suyapa Marina de 32  años de edad,  tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo en casa propia,  ubicada en la comunidad de Nacaome al sur de Honduras.
Doña Suyapa Marina se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de golosinas sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de leña, papas, yuca, plátanos, aceite,  refrescos, etc.  Con el apoyo de este crédito espera tener suficiente productos para elaborar sus golosinas y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y también que le genere ganancias a su negocio. 
Uno de sus sueños  es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Suyapa Marina is 32 years old, she has 2 children who depend on her. She lives with her husband in a house they own, located in the community of Nacaome in the south of Honduras. Suyapa Marina has worked for 5 years in the business of candy sales. Her clients are neighbors and friends. She is asking for a loan to purchase firewood, potatoes, yucca, bananas, oil, sodas, etc. With the help of this loan, she hopes to have enough products to make her candy and satisfy the demand of her customers, and also generates profits for her business. One of her dreams is to improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – May 2015.

loans.use: to buy firewood, potatoes, yucca, bananas, oil, sodas, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Maydielyn

texts.en:
God continually molds the people who are willing to submit to His tending hands. Maydielyn, 25, is a single parent who has learned to give up her former unpleasant lifestyle through the guidance of God and her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative in Caloocan City. She managed to turn her old habits into productive ways of income generation. She now has RTW business that sells pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, undergarments, and other ready-to-wear apparels. The income derived from her business sustains her and her child’s everyday needs. It’s challenging for her to manage her household and business simultaneously, but her child serves as her daily motivation. 

Maydielyn normally experiences stiff competition in business, but she focuses on her goal to provide for her child’s needs and send her to a reputable school someday. This goal fuels her to expand her business by making it more enticing to customers. She plans to buy more up-to-date clothes and add sweaters or jackets in time for the rainy season. She needs additional capital worth PhP 8,000 to buy these items so she can gain extra profit and savings. As much as possible, she desires to prepare early for her child’s future and guide her towards the right path. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more up-to-date clothes plus sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 49 years old, married with six children.

Noemi works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Noemi has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising livestock and rice retailing.

Noemi aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aroni

texts.en:
Aroni is 37 years old. He is married with three children aged between 4 and 10 years. They all go to school. 

He owns a shop and he has been in a business for the past five years, while his wife is a business lady also. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, salt and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Sulkhan

texts.en:
Sulkhan is 27 years old. He lives in the small village of Chao in Khulo district with his sister, brother, mother and pensioner grandmother. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and a plot of agricultural land where they grow potatoes and maize. 

Sulkhan is a very hardworking man and does his best to insure a good harvest. He owns a flat which needs to be renovated. The Start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to renovate a flat and rent it out at a good price.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out

loans.name: Mongnamsang Group

texts.en:
Ihn’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. 

Ihn and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  

Ihn and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years filter users, like Ihn’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is 60 years old, married, and has a grown son.  He has been retired for 6 years. Since leaving his job, he found another part-time job as a guard at a local parking area.

Sergei needs additional funds to buy a fridge and a TV set, which has been his dream for a while. Sergei needs 12,000 UAH to buy these household items. He needs a new fridge because he wants to freeze berries and vegetables for the winter. He also wants a TV with a bigger screen because he has poor eyesight (even after vision correction surgery) and cannot see much from too far.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and a TV set

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, propane, etc., to increase her sales and improve her income

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 61 years old, married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Zenaida has a fishing business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Zenaida has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 57 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 56 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sandra is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Sandra has been raising pigs for 25 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jhonamie

texts.en:
Jhonamie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a natural medicine business in the Philippines.

Jhonamie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of food supplement to offer for sale.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Jhonamie would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food supplement to offer for sale.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending.  Lorna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is a widow with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Condrada is 58 years old and has two children who are in school.

Condrada has a food vending business in the Philippines. Condrada requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Condrada has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Condrada would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fish vending.

Yolanda dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like poultry and farming sugarcane businesses.

Noemi dreams that one day She will be able to save money to expand business

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 43 years old and has seven children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Analie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Analie requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Analie has been farming rice for six years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analie would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Haydee works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Haydee is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her repair shop business.

Haydee has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her auto repair shop.

loans.name: Manasseh

texts.en: Manasseh is 35 years old. He is married with one child, who is 10 years old and in primary school. He enrolled in 2014 and he plans to complete his primary school in 2017. The only way of getting school fees is to request a loan, which helps Manasseh to pay in installments, easily, depending on his capacity. After studies, Massaneh's child plans to improve his standard of living and prepare his better future.

loans.use: To pay his child's school fees in installments, easily, depending on his capacity.

loans.name: Confidence Traders Group

texts.en:
Veronica is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her 6 children and her husband at Mankessim in the Mfantsiman District of the Central Region of Ghana. Her first born child is 23 years old, and her youngest is 10 years old. All 6 of her children are in school. 

Veronica is the leader of Confidence Traders Group. She is a trader and sells bags of rice, eggs, and other provisions. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years and works alone. Veronica wants to expand her business and to start selling salted fish, which are in very high demand in her region. Over the next five years, Veronica wants to add more lines of items to her existing inventory and to increase her stock of salted fish to expand her gross sales and profit.  

Veronica needs micro loan support to buy more bags of rice, crates of eggs, provisions, and salted fish to meet the demand for her goods. Veronica has been very committed and faithful to her repayment obligations during all of her past 9 loan cycles with the Field Partner (since 2010). Veronica intends to use the profit from her business to improve her family's living conditions and to expand her business. Veronica thanks all of her Kiva lenders for their kind financial assistance that helps improve the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, crates of eggs, provisions, and salted fish for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 24-year old high school graduate who lives in La Carlota City. She is married to Ronald, who works as a farm laborer. They have 2 children aged 6 and 4. Their total monthly family income is only P6,000 ($134). 

Jocelyn wants to help her husband but didn't have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere's selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Jocelyn dreams to have a stable job and have an adequate income. Once Jocelyn starts earning, she can provide for her family's basic needs and then save some money for her children's education. Your assistance in funding her loan will help Jocelyn reach her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Edgar Gerald

texts.en:
Edgar Gerald is a 22-year old high school graduate who lives in Silay City. He belongs to a family of 7. His father is a bus driver and his mother has a mini grocery in their house. Edgar Gerald is the eldest in the family and he has 5 younger siblings. His brother works in a call center in Manila, one of his siblings is in elementary school and the other one is in high school, while his 2 siblings are in college. The family's monthly income of P16,000 ($357) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs.

 Edgar Gerald wants to earn more for himself and for his family, and he believes that the training at Bagosphere will allow him to realize this goal. Edgar Gerald wants to work in a BPO company that provides a high standard of customer service along with a good salary. He aims to improve his English, help his family and send his siblings to college once he gets a stable job and income.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Banele

texts.en:
Banele (37) is a single mother of a 17-year-old girl and 15-year-old boy. She has been running a daycare center for the last eight years, growing it to a successful center with four employees and an ever-growing number of children. 

She is requesting a loan to buy and install two toilet units as well as upgrade the center's plumbing system. "I want to have a center that supports itself and gives me money, too" says a hopeful Banele. She plans to open an orphanage in the next five years to help the hundreds of destitute children in her area.

loans.use: to buy and install two ceramic toilets and upgrade the center's plumbing system

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina works as a private entrepreneur at a local marketplace in Pavlograd. She owns a small vending pavilion where she sells women's athletic clothing items. Galina has been working in this line of business for 19 years. She is 51 years old, divorced, and has a grown daughter. 

Galina is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional merchandise for sale, including women's sportswear, t-shirts, capris, etc. This type of merchandise always sells well among female customers during the summer in Ukraine.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for sale, including women's sportswear, t-shirts, capris, etc.

loans.name: Angel Fernando

texts.es: Angel tiene 28 años de edad es soltero vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar el se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife que son para la salud, solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo para invertir en estos productos, y mejorar la calidad de vida, su sueño es comprarse un carro y en su tiempo libre le gusta leer libros.
texts.en: Angel, 28, is single and lives in Guaranda in Bolivar province.  He sells Herbalife health products and is applying for a loan that he will use to stock his business with products for resale.  The investment will support his business and improve his quality of life.  He says that he likes to read in his spare time and that he hopes to buy a car one day.

loans.use: to stock his Herbalife business.

loans.name: Nancy Ximena

texts.es: Nancy tiene 22 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad el Castillo, solicita el crédito para la compra de productos Herbalife para tener variedad y poder vender mas, gracias al crédito podra mejorar su negocio y su vida, su meta es tener su propia empresa y ayudar a la sociedad, y en su tiempo libre le gusta leer libros de superación personal.
texts.en: Nancy is 22 years old, she is single and lives with her parents in Guaranda, province of Bolivar, in the community of Castillo. She asks for the loan to purchase Herbalife to have more variety and be able to sell more. Thanks to the loan, she will improve her business and her life. Her goal is to have her own company and help society, and in her free time she enjoys reading self-help books.

loans.use: to purchase Herbalife products to have more variety.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is 28 years old. He lives with his parents and sister in Telavi district, east Georgia. Aleksandre is unemployed and wants to start up a new business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to purchase auto spare parts and open an auto repair workshop. Aleksandre is experienced in this field and hopes that he will be successful in his new business. He will work hard to generate income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and open an auto repair workshop

loans.name: Mujeres Group

texts.en:
Nahualá is one of 19 towns in Sololá, a state in Guatemala's Western Highlands that is some 90 miles west of the capital.  It is the home of the Mujeres Friendship Bridge Trust Bank.  The group is setting out on its second round of funding.  Their first round of funding was a success and they are applying for a new loan now. 

Maria, 35, is the president of “Mujeres”.  She is an enterprising woman and has a business making traditional skirts (“cortes”). She also makes and sells snack foods.  She is head of her family and works hard to support them and provide for her children's education. Maria will use part of her loan to buy bulk supplies of the quality thread she needs to make "corteses".  She will use the rest of her share of the loan to buy supplies for her food business.  Maria’s businesses have grown so much that now has three employees, each of whom is now able to support his or her own family!

Maria and the women in the Trust Bank are grateful to the Friendship Bridge facilitator who comes to their monthly meetings. The facilitator shares practical knowledge with the group on a variety of everyday subjects like business administration, health and nutrition, and self-esteem. The combination of small loans and education is called “Microcredit Plus”. Quite simply, it works!

The “Mujeres” are grateful to KIVA investors for believing in them and understanding that they will use the loan funds responsibly. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: comprara más cantidad de hilo fino para surtir y ofrecer calidad para su clientela.

loans.name: Angel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (BERNICIA, FIDELIA y WALESKA), viven en  Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Hace 12 meses se organizaron en grupo solidario con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

BERNICIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario ÁNGEL, es una señora cordial de 54 años de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 10 años vende bastimestos y frijoles en uno de los mercados de Bilwi, extiende sacos masen para exhibir sus productos en las aceras y para cubrirse del sol coloca platico negro enlazado con tablas de madera. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar: Naranja, plátanos, filipitas, frijoles entre otros bastimentos. Ella sueña con llegar a tener el suficiente capital para establecer una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This supportive group is made up of three entrepreneurial women (Bernicia, Fidelia, and Waleska). They live in Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas Twelve months ago they organized in a group with the goal of working in a solidary way to have access to loans from Pana Pana and to have the opportunity to improve the quality of life of their families.

Bernicia: she is a member of the supportive group Angel. She is a kind woman who is 54 years old. With the goal of having her own source of income, for ten years she has sold food supplies and beans in one of the markets in Bilwi. She spreads out sacks to exhibit her products on sidewalks, and to cover from the sun she places black plastic attached to wooden boards. She is asking for financing to buy: oranges, bananas, beans, among other food supplies. She dreams of having enough capital to open a new clothing store.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, beans, among other food supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She has three children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Grace has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which she owns and which transacts essential goods. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to access more household items to increase her profits. Grace will generate greater profits, her profits will increase, and she will manage to take her kids to better schools. Grace hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up another business of a poultry farm. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to access more household items to increase her profits.

loans.name: Karla Raquel
