texts.es: Karla de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 6 años su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, blusas, zapatos, etc. para continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Karla, 32, and her family have a house of their own.  She has operated a clothing and footwear sales business for 6 years.  She operates the business at a heavily-trafficked spot near her house and has, consequently, many customers.  Her earnings from the business help to cover family expenses.  Karla is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with the merchandise she sells: pants, shirts, blouses, shoes, etc.  The investment will allow her to carry on the business and continue providing for her family.

loans.use: to stock her clothing and footwear sales business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children, with three of them currently in school. For the past two years, Florence has been working hard to manage her agro business, which deals in agricultural items. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to access more agro-chemical items for sale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and manage to pay for school needs for her kids in time. Florence hopes that in the future, she will be able to develop her community by creating more jobs by expanding her business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to access more agro-chemical items for sale.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, with three of them currently in school. Aidah has been working hard to manage her bakery business, which vends bread and doughnuts. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to obtain baking flour, cooking oil and other items to complete her baking business, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and manage to pay her mother's medical bills through hard work and stocking more in her bakery business. 

Aidah hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger baking company so as to start employing more workers, hence creating jobs in her community. 

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aidah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to obtain baking flour, cooking oil and other items to complete her baking business

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz y cal para seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, age 37, lives in her own house with her family.  She works selling tortillas; she has done this for three years.  Her business is located in her place of residence.  She has a lot of customers, especially her neighbors.  

She is asking for a loan to buy corn and mineral lime in order to continue with her sales because this is her only source of work, and with it she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and mineral lime

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old. He is not married and has no children at the moment. 

He has had a general merchandise business for four years, and it has been successful. 

John has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more stock of maize cereals in sacks. With the anticipated profits, John hopes this will help him educate his brother. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be able to educate his future children to higher education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize cereals in sacks

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar moved to the United States from Uganda approximately two years ago. His wife and three children are currently still in Uganda, and are attempting to relocate to the United States. Since arriving in the U.S., Edgar has established a tour business. The business offers 3-day tours by luxury bus from San Diego to Las Vegas.  Edgar leases the buses from a third party and coordinates all the travel accommodations for the trips. 

Edgar has more 20 years of experience in the tour industry, as he ran and continues to run from abroad, the same kind of business in Uganda. His family in Uganda continues to help run the tour business, taking tourists to national parks to observe the animals. Edgar has taken his experience from that business in Uganda and learned to adapt it to his business here in the U.S.

When he isn’t working on his tour business, Edgar is studying to become a R.N. 

Edgar will use his Kiva funds to pay in advance to book tour buses for his transportation company. To this point he has been using his own funds and the proceeds of the tours, but he is looking to expand. One day, he dreams of owning his own tour bus, so he doesn’t have to lease them. 

“I have a passion for transportation and I love what I do,” said Edgar. “I will do what it takes to have my business succeed, so I can support my family.”

loans.use: to pay in advance to book tour buses for his transportation company.

loans.name: Mency

texts.en:
Mency is 43 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mency has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: José Eustaquio

texts.es: José de 71 años, posee una amplia experiencia en su negocio de venta de cervezas y refrescos, este emprendedor hombre empezó a laborar desde muy joven, cuando su padre que ejercía esta misma actividad le permitió vincularse en el negocio. Tras su fallecimiento, José quedó a cargo del negocio y con empeño y dedicación, tuvo éxito, hoy en día cuenta con una gran clientela que disfruta de estas bebidas en un agradable lugar, apto para compartir en familia, con amigos o simplemente para pasar un rato de esparcimiento y diversión, recibiendo una excelente atención.  Todos los días a partir de las 3 p.m. hasta las 12 de la media noche sus clientes gozan de estos servicios y en pro de continuar con un stock que satisfaga la demanda, está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que utilizará en la compra al por mayor de canastas de cervezas, gaseosas y refrescos.  Esta inversión le permitirá obtener descuentos y maximizar sus utilidades.  Su principal desafío es continuar ofreciendo un excelente servicio para continuar siendo preferido por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jose, 71 years old, has a lot of experience working in his business selling beer and soft drinks. This enterprising man started working when he was very young, when his father did the same kind of work, which allowed him establish himself in the business. After his father passed away, Jose took over the business, and with effort and dedication, became successful. Today, he has a large clientele which enjoys these drinks in a pleasant locale, perfect to have a drink with friends or family, or simply to spend some time relaxing and having fun while receiving excellent service. 

Every day from 3pm to midnight, his customers enjoy these services, and with the objective of continuing to provide enough stock to meet demand, he is applying for his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to purchase crates of beer, soda water, and soft drinks wholesale. This investment will allow him to obtain discounts and maximize his profits. His main objective is to keep offering excellent service so that he can continue to be the favorite of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase crates of beer, soda water, and soft drinks wholesale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gina is 34 years old and has one child who is in school.

Gina has a food market business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Gina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jocabed

texts.en:
Jocabed is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past five years, Jocabed has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which vends essential household goods. 

To help expand her business, Jocabed has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to obtain more household items to increase her profits, and will help Jocabed to generate greater profits and manage to take her kids to better schools. Jocabed hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a good and productive life. 

Jocabed is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jocabed who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to obtain more household items to increase her profits.

loans.name: Mavludahon

texts.ru: Мавлудахон из района Рудаки. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Мавлудахону 62 года. Она 43 года работает медсестрой в больнице.  Мавлудахон заботливая, жизнелюбивая и добрая женщина. Она любить помогать и сделать добро людям. На фотографии снято Мавлудахон и его сын, который болеет. Ее дети тоже воспитанные и заботливые. Ее сыну очень плохо, ему надо сделать операции, чтобы сохранить его жизнь. Мавлудахон не смогла собрать денег, потому что ее ежемесячная зарплата не хватает на жилищные расходы. Она была вынуждена, обратится к Вам за кредитом. Мавлудахон  очень надеется на Вашу поддержку. Она любить своих детей, и не хочет их потерять, дети еще молоды и их жизнь впереди. Любая мама тоже так поступила бы на месте Мавлудахон. Поддержите ее!
texts.en: Mavludahon is from the Rudaki region. She is married and the mother of three children. Mavludahon is 62 years old. She has worked for 43 years as a hospital nurse. Mavludahon is a caring, joyful and kind woman. She loves to help and to do good to others. Her son is very ill. He needs an operation in order to save his life. Mavludahon has not been able to collect the money because her monthly salary is not sufficient for her living expenses. She has been obliged to turn to you for a loan. Mavludahon very much hopes for your support. She loves her children and does not want to lose them. Her children are still young and their lives are ahead. Any mother would do the same in Mavludahon's place. Please support her!

loans.use: to pay for an operation and treatment for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 19 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 4 años el cual inicio con capital propio, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitado un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. y así continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: The face of the young man in the photo has been distorted because he is only 19 years old and lives in a high-risk part of the country.  He has operated a farming business, growing maize, for 4 years.  He started the business with his own money and sells what he harvests at nearby markets.  He and his family live in a house of their own.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--fertilizer, herbicides, seeds--to carry on his business.  The business is his only source of income and he is determined to support it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years old, married, and has four children.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pig.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 29 years old, married,  and has two children still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lea has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Medy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Medy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Medy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marycon

texts.en:
Marycon is 43 years old and has eight children. She is married and has five children are presently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pig.

Marycon has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as noodles, cigarettes, sweets, rice, and other things to sell. 

Juvita first opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $500. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And with the loan she can improve her management of her business.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sweets, rice, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia has been involved in business activity since 2014. She started her business with her own working capital of $300. 

Lelia has a shop of her business. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants use to buy additional supplies, including sardines, sugar, salt, soap, soy sauce, aqua, candles, medicines, crackers, candy, glue, and other things to sell. 

She is happy because, with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business bigger in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: To buy sardines, sugar, salt, soap, soy sauce, aqua, candles, medicines, crackers, candy, glue, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 54 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are attending school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Cynthia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Cynthia has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from food vending and clothing retail businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 44 years old and married with four children; two of her children are still in school, and Nemia works very hard to provide for them.

Nemia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, bread, etc.

Nemia has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, bread, etc

loans.name: Mercedes Faustino

texts.es: Don Mercedes Faustino de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia adicional a eso también se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Mercedes Faustino is 46 years old, he lives in a house he owns with his mother. He has a business of auto body work and paint located in his place of residence. On top of his, he also works in agriculture. He farms corn, and with his income from his work he manages to settle some of his household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy paint, varnish, oils, and other tools to keep working and obtain more income, to give his family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy paint, varnish, oils, and other tools.

loans.name: Amigas Solidarias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Damiana es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de coca, venta de papa, venta de dulces, venta de frutas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Damiana es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años. 

El crédito que sacara será para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que lo adquirirá del Departamento de Cochabamba para posteriormente comercializarlo en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
en la foto aparecen solo siete integrantes ya que el señor Yerko Agudo, después del desembolso, tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The communal bank Amigas Solidarias are starting their third cycle with Pro Mujer, working with one of the organisation's regional offices in Villa Tejada. There are eight members, and it is managed by a board of directors of which Damiana is secretary. 

The members of this communal bank are all working to improve very different businesses, including: sales of milk, clothing, coca, potato, candy, fruit, and a local store. 

The loan will benefit female micro-entrepreneurs, including Damiana. She says that she joined Pro Mujer by invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling fruit, she explains that she learned this business several years ago through her own initiative.

This loan will be to increase her stock (to buy fruit in bulk) which she will acquire from the Cochabamba department, to then sell in the fairs in the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family economically, as she is single and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and the healthcare that the institution offers.

There are only seven members in the photo, as after the payment Yerko Agudo needed to leave to go to his shopping stall.

loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk

loans.name: Erlis Antonio

texts.es: Erlis de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 18 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los sacos que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializar sus productos agrícolas en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como  semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, entre otras cosas y seguir con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Erlis is 38 years old and lives in a house he owns with his family. He has worked in corn cultivation for 18 years, when the harvest is ready it is stored in the sacks shown in the photograph. Later he sells his agricultural products in the different markets that are located close to his house. He is asking for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicide, among other things, and continue with his crops to have a better economic income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicide, among other things.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 29 years old and a married woman. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Jenny has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell in her store like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Jenny has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store like canned goods, personal care products, etc

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.en:
Rosabella is 40 years old and has six children. She is married and has four children who are presently in school.

Rosabella is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rosabella has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia is a married woman, 61 years old with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Roselia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Roselia has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is a widow and has six children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Grace has been working hard to manage her Agro business, where she sells Agro items in her store. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more Agro chemical items for sale, and will help Grace to generate greater profits. Her profits will increase and she will manage to send her kids to better schools. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the Agro business so as to start supplying all the farmers in town at a cheaper price. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more Agro chemical items for sale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 24 años de edad es soltero vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad el Castillo, se dedica a la agricultura y solicita el crédito para poder nmjorar los sembrios de naranja y cacao ya que con este dinero podra comprar los inasumos agricolas necesarios, el compra en Milagro y en Guaranda los insumos el sueño de el es mejor su economia y el desafio al que se enfrenta es la competencia, en el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Manuel is 24 years old and single.  He lives in the Castillo community in Guaranda in the Bolivar province.  He devotes himself to agriculture.

He is requesting the loan to be able to improve his orange and cacao crops.  With this money he will be able to buy the needed agricultural supplies.  He will buy the supplies in Milagro and in Guaranda.

His dream is to improve his finances.  The challenge that he faces is the competition.

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Bellaflor

texts.en:
Bellaflor is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Bellaflor is 51 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Bellaflor has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Bellaflor has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mujeres En Marcha Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (AMELIA BEATRIZ, MARIA TERESA y STEFANIE MARGIENE), todas pertenecen a la etnia miskita y viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan diario para generar ingresos desde sus pequeños negocios.

MARIA TERESA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario MUJERES EN MARCHA, es una señora con cualidades de líder, casada. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 10 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar: Granos Básicos, chiverías, huevos, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This united group is comprised of three women (Amelia Beatriz, Maria Teresa, and Stefanie Margiene).  They are all of the Miskita ethnicity, and they live in Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality.  They are enterprising women who struggle every day in order to generate income from their small businesses.

Maria Teresa is the coordinator of the Mujeres En Marcha united group.  She is a woman with the qualities of a leader.  She is married.  In order to have her own source of income, she started a small grocery store ten years ago.  It is in the hallway of her stilt and wood home.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, and soft drinks, among other products.  

She dreams of being a successful merchant.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, and soft drinks, among other products.

loans.name: Maria Reina

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace 5 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando las puertas y el portón principal, pero ya que no cuenta con suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de las puertas y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su esposo puedan vivir seguros.
texts.en:
Maria, age 47, lives in her own house with her husband.  She has been selling seafood for five years.  With what she gets from her sales, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

She wants to improve her house by installing doors and a front gate.  However, she does not have enough money now.  She is requesting a loan to buy the materials needed to make the doors and to pay for the labor so that she and her husband are able to live safely.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to make doors and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 63 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Carolina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carolina has been in this business for 31 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carmen is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Carmen has a buy-and-sell multivitamin and medicine business in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of multivitamins and medicines to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of multivitamins and medicines to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 47 years old and married with nine children. With two children currently in school, Conchita works very hard to provide for them.

Conchita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, coffee, cereals, milk, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, coffee, cereals, milk, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 33 years old and lives in the town of Bundibunyo in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is a widow and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her clothing sales boutique business. 

To help expand her business, Jenifer has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add different types of fashionable clothes to resell, and will help Jenifer to generate greater profits. This will improve the family's ability to cover basic needs and allow her to pay their school needs . Jenifer hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her store into a bigger whole sale shop. 

Jenifer is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jenifer who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add different types of fashionable clothing to her store.

loans.name: Job Misael

texts.es: Job de 26 años de edad vive muy feliz junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijas la mayor de 2 años y la menor de 1 mes de edad, en casa propia y humilde. Él es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable que quiere dar a su familia un futuro mejor, por lo que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de medicina natural de forma ambulante en su comunidad y los mercados cercanos, además del transporte público, dicha actividad la realiza diariamente con estos ingresos es como lleva el sustento a su familia y en ocasiones, su esposa le ayuda a vender la medicina natural en los alrededores de la comunidad. Job solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder construir dos muros para que su familia pueda tener un hogar mejor .El invertirá en: ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y grava para construir dos muros en su propiedad brindando mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Job, who is 26 years old, lives very happily with his wife and two daughters, the oldest is two years old, and the youngest is one month old, in a humble house they own. He is a hard-working and responsible father who wants to give a better future to his family, which is why for three years, he has worked as a street vendor in his community, selling natural medicine in the nearby markets and in public transport. He does this activity every day. With this income is how he brings sustenance to his family, and sometimes his wife helps him sell the medicine in the surroundings of the community. Job asks for a credit from FUSAI to be able to build two walls so that his family can have a better home. He will invest in: brick, cement, sand, iron, and gravel to build two walls in his home, bringing more comfort to his family.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, iron, and gravel to build two walls on his property, bringing more comfort to his family.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past 8 years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, which owns a beauty salon that does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 3500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to bargain more hair braids and hair relaxers for her salon to increase on her sales, and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and improving her standards of living. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to have a very big and attractive salon around town. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fatuma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to bargain more hair braids and hair relaxers for her salon to increase her sales,

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy  is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cristy  is 23 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Cristy  has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Cristy  has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Dina has been in this business for 4 years now.

Dina has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Dina would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu is a widowed mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a weaving business  which earns her another source of income.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and containers of cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and containers of cooking fat

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years old and lives in the town of Natete A in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is Married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her Retail shop, which owns a retail shop that sales essential goods. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to obtain other more essential goods to attract her customers, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and manage to pay school tuition for her kids in better schools. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger supermarket in town. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to obtain other more essential goods for her general store, to attract her customers,

loans.name: Despertar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DESPERTAR” iniciará el vigésimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de flores, venta de bicicletas, venta de productos nutricionales, venta de ropa folfklórica, venta de verduras, venta de ropa.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos nutricionales; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia y lo que le ayudo a emprender este negocio fueron los pocos ahorros que tenia.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de jarabes, batidos y tónicos por mayor) que los adquirirá de una empresa en la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, lo comercializara en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que  ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Despertar are starting their 24th cycle with Pro Mujer, working with one of the organisation's regional offices in Santiago. It is made up of nine members, and is managed by a board of directors of which Maria is resident. The members of this communal bank are all working to improve very different businesses, including: sales of flowers, bicycles, nutritional products, traditional clothing, vegetables and clothes.

The loan will benefit female micro-entrepreneurs, including Maria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer by invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling nutritional products; she says that she learned this business several years ago through her own initiative. The few savings she had had helped her to launch the business.

This loan will be to increase her stock (to buy syrups, milkshakes and tonics in bulk) which she will acquire from a business in the city of La Paz, to then sell on at her shopping stall. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family economically, as she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the healthcare and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy syrups, milkshakes and tonics in bulk

loans.name: Polly

texts.en:
Polly is 47 years old and lives in the town of Makindye, in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Polly has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential house hold goods. 

To help expand her business, Polly has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items like water and rice to increase her sales. This will help Polly to generate greater profits and improve her family's living condition. She will also be able to pay their school fees . 

Polly hopes that in the future she will be able to build more rental houses in the remaining space of land. 

Polly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Polly who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy essential items like water and rice to increase her sales.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her business, which sells polythene bags and a soft drinks.

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more polythene bags and soft drinks, and will help Florence to generate greater profits. She will use the profits to help meet her family needs like paying for her kids school fees. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to own one of the best boutiques. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more polythene bags and soft drinks.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo is 37 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is Married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Teo has been working hard to manage her polythene bag business, which deals in polythene bags. 

To help expand her business, Teo has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add in another business like buying in soft drinks and some snacks, and will help Teo to generate greater profits and will be in position to meet her other basic needs of her own. Teo hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch in a different town. 

Teo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add in another business like buying in soft drinks and some snacks,

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en:
Gorret is 43 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is Married and has 6 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her hard ware, which owns a hard ware shop that sales building materials. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to invest in more materials for the store for sale, and will help Gorret to generate greater profits and improved her business she managed to add more stock that increased her profits. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to start purchasing most of these items by herself in the bigger factories that produce the materials. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gorret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to invest in more materials for her hardware store for sale
